localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=BannerLor: Hereditary Knights of Kaerok, the Banner Lords swear blind allegiance to King Tayba. His majesty has tasked them with waging his war of expansion, and protecting the royal administrators posted at Kaerok Castle. These fearsome knights will let no soul pass without a royal scroll.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=Barbarian: The Barbarians of Hark'han are opportunists ever eager to offer their mercenary services to the highest bidder. When the servants of the Corruption first came from the East with their dragon, they quickly made a pact granting them control of the region they now patrol as the Deadlands.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=DarkElves: Fallen from grace in their homelands of Aravia, the Dark Elves inhabit the forests that border the realms of Teleria. They see the persecutions in Kaerok rather as a boon than a bane supplying them with a stream of silver. They have set up tolls for those anxious to pass safely, but woe betide those who cannot pay.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=Demonspaw: Beyond the dark portal lies a realm of fire and darkness. It is the home of ancient beings born of darkness. Forbidden from setting foot in the fair lands of Teleria, these foul entities have conspired with Necromancers to breed Demonspawn - unholy unions of Demon and mortal.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=HighElves: High Elves originate in Aravia where they have built a wondrous, shimmering city. Living in these lands of plenty has enabled them to evolve their society to the highest degree of physical, intellectual, and spiritual achievement. High-principled, they welcome exiles and offer them new homes further east.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=KnightsRe: Disciples of the K'leth death cult, the Knights Revenant see themselves as vessels of the spirits of the dead of their order. They raid indiscriminately to capture slaves to support themselves and as ritual sacrifices. Upon initiation, devotees surrender their bodies to the spirits of dark warriors.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=OgrynTrib: Subhuman giants with prodigious bellies and brawn, Ogryns are nonetheless sluggish, dumb brutes prone to servitude. Yet these terrifying great oafs often prove that brute force and ignorance will often win the day. Together with the Skinwalkers they control Felwin's Gate, entry to the Kingdom of Aravia.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=Orcs#labe: Orcish tribes maintain a tenuous hold in pockets from Durham Forest to the Deadlands. Initially bred as warrior slaves, Orcs do what they must to ensure their survival, and will pick off unwitting travellers for their coin, blood and bones. Fearful of persecution by the men of Kaerok, they have sided with the Queen of Aravia.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=SacredOrd: For centuries the Knights of the Sacred Order were charged with cleansing Teleria of evil in all its guises. But since the declaration of war, they have sworn allegiance to the Queen of Aravia. In league with the Queen's Necromancer, these once-holy knights now enforce her majesty's will and guard her chattel.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=Skinwalke: As told by the tragic legend of Ch'arocah, Skinwalkers once had the power to cast themselves in the form of any man or beast. But after centuries of overuse, these shamans found themselves entrapped as something less than human, but more than animal. Though wild and dangerous, they can sense evil and may act to prevent it.
localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=UndeadHor: Awakened by the call of the Corruption, these ghouls and creatures of the night inhabit the forgotten tombs and dark places of the world, and serve as minions to the Dark One. While most are the desecrated carcasses of fallen Telerians, others have lurked in the darkness for centuries... awaiting their time.

localizedStrings.l10n:hero/fraction?description=LizardMen: The Lizardmen evolved from the brackish waters of Teleria long before modern humanoid races emerged with more powerful brains. These fearsome amphibious bipeds have been deemed untouchable but are tolerated in swamps and city sewers. They trade through messengers to get sustenance, or ransom for their captives.

Dear Player! 
Raid: Shadow Legends is currently in a <color=#1ee600>pre-launch testing period</color>. When we officially launch and Raid: Shadow Legends goes live, we will reset our servers. 
This means any progress and purchases made on your account will be <color=#1ee600>lost</color>, unless you <color=#1ee600>connect your game to a Plarium ID</color>. 
Create a Plarium ID now to save your progress and protect your account.

localizedStrings.l10n:portal/summon/missed-sacred-shard#d: Sacred Shards are a special type of Shard that Summon the most powerful Champions. You can get Sacred Shards from promotional offers, or by completing Monthly Quests.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/battle-finis: Along with special items, your Champions will earn XP after every battle. Earn enough, and they'll level up - growing in strength and power.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/heroes-info-: This is where you can view all Champions under your control.
See that? Your Artifact has already strengthened this Champion. Better yet, Artifacts can be equipped in Sets to provide special bonuses and effects.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/heroes-selec: This is where you select your team and review the enemy Champions before each battle. Each Champion has unique skills, and an Affinity that makes them weak or strong against another Affinity.

<color=#4faefd>Magic</color> beats <color=#41d559>Spirit</color>, <color=#41d559>Spirit</color> beats <color=#f72f2f>Force</color>, <color=#f72f2f>Force</color> beats <color=#4faefd>Magic</color>, and <color=#fb78f9>Void</color> is special - <color=#fb78f9>Void</color> Champions have no direct weaknesses against other Affinities.
You have only 2 Champions now. Let's pick your team.
Well done. Notice that your Leader has an Aura skill. These provide special bonuses to all allied Champions in a battle.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/map/message-: Behold: Kaerok Castle, seat of King Tayba. This is where your journey begins.
I fear that the King and his Banner Lords have fallen to the Shadow. Once noble and just, he has brought war upon his Allies and ruin on his people...
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/portal-dialo: Mystery Shards allow you to summon Common, Uncommon and Rare Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/portal-hero-: Excellent. You've summoned an ATK type Champion, with great attack and support Skills. Let's head to the Campaign Map and prepare your Champions for their first taste of combat.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/region-dialo: Kaerok will not fall easily. Like all places in Teleria, there are multiple stages of defenders. You must defeat all stages to move forward with your journey.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/village/mess: Awaken, warrior. This is your Bastion. From here you will summon and train Champions to fight the dark one and his Shadow.
You have chosen your first Champion - but one Champion is not an army. Use a Mystery Shard to summon another Champion at the Portal.
Go to your Champion Collection and equip that Artifact.
I believe you are ready. Return to Kaerok Castle, seat of King Tayba of Kaerok. Fight through his Banner Lords and find him. I must know if he has succumbed to the Shadow...

localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/level-up-ove: Congratulations - you levelled up! Every time you Level up, you'll get full Energy, Gems, and sometimes you'll even unlock new features.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/battle-finis: And here are your rewards from battle. With this Artifact you have enough to equip a full set. Let's go.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/heroes-info-: Artifacts can be equipped individually, but come in sets of 2 or 4. Equipping full sets can give you huge stat boosts, special abilities, or add special modifiers to your attacks.
Special icons will show which Artifact sets a Champion is equipped with. Tap on the set icon to read more about which bonuses it gives to your Champions.
This set boosts your Champion's HP by 15%. Life Artifacts come in sets of 2, meaning you can gain a huge 45% HP boost with 3 sets. Let's upgrade this Artifact and improve its bonuses.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/artifact-pow: Excellent work. When you upgrade Artifacts to certain levels, they gain new substats, giving your Champions an even bigger boost.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/village/mess: You have learned well. Keep strengthening your warriors. I shall return in time to teach you more.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage1-dialog1#message: I think I'll pass on this one.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage1-dialog2#message: Elhain, I think he likes you.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage1-dialog4#message: Well shot! Where did you learn that?
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage1-dialog6#message: The Arbiter cannot bind me forever, Elf. You and I will have our day. Let's keep moving...
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage2-dialog1#message: Four of them! Come on! Which of you filth dies first today?
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage2-dialog2#message: Athel, we really don't have time for this.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage2-dialog4#message: By the light... I'm glad you're on our side.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage2-dialog5#message: Oh, yes. Just one big happy family, mortal. Move along. The sooner we win, the sooner I'm free of you.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage3-dialog1#message: Spread out. The artifact should be here somewhere.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage3-dialog2#message: Easy, everyone. Every dragon has a weak spot.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage3-dialog3#message: If I can hit it just right...
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage3-dialog4#message: Haha! I think I like this dragon.
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage3-dialog5#message: Well that could have gone better. Any ideas?
localizedStrings.l10n:intro/stage3-dialog6#message: We attack together. On three! For Teleria! For the Arbiter!

localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/feature/speaker-message/aren: This is Classic Arena - where you compete against other players in traditional 4 versus 4 battles.
Basic Arena play is split into 2 types: Offense and Defense.

localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/feature/speaker-message/intr: I thought these Champions may have been the ones...
Yet it seems I have failed. They were not ready.

Teleria is dying, consumed by war and discord. Even now, dark forces in the service of Siroth spread a foul Shadow from the East. As guardian of Teleria, I have done what I can, but my power is almost spent.
This task now falls to you.
I have strength left to restore only one fallen Champion to aid you. With their Shard remade, they will be bound to your will...
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/prize-info-o: Excellent. Campaign levels drop artifacts - and here's your first. Artifacts are powerful items that boost your Champions' stats.

localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/feature/speaker-message/tave: You can Ascend Champions by using Potions to unlock new Skills and greatly increase their Stats.

A Champion's Ascension Level is indicated by the number of purple stars.
Ascension is also limited by a Champion's Rank.
You can sacrifice weaker Champions to gain XP and level up quickly.
Levelling up increases a Champion's stats, making their skills even stronger.

When a Champion hits the maximum level for their Rank, you need to upgrade their Rank to keep improving them.
Each new Rank increases a Champion's level limit.
To Upgrade a Champion's Rank, you need to sacrifice Champions or Chickens of the same Rank. The number of Champions you need to sacrifice depends on the Rank.

Upgrading Skills is the key to maximizing a Champion's effectiveness.
Upgrading a Skill can improve its strength, such as Heal or attack power, or even its Buff or Debuff activation chance.
You can Upgrade a Champion's Skills in 2 ways: either by sacrificing duplicate Champions, or by using Skill Tomes.
Skill Tomes come in 3 different Rarities: Rare, Epic, and Legendary  with each able to upgrade the Skills of different rarities of Champions.
A Rank 4 Champion can be ascended 4 times, while a Rank 3 Champion can only be ascended 3 times.

The type of Potion needed to ascend a Champion depends on his or her Affinity.
The best place to find Potions is in the Potion Dungeons.
Epic Skill Tomes can upgrade Uncommon, Common, Rare, and Epic Champions, but won't work on Legendary Champions.
Epic and Legendary Skill Tomes are extremely rare, so don't waste them. You never want to use a Legendary Tome upgrading a Rare Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/feature/speaker-message/aren: And this is where you set your Arena Defense. Make sure you keep it up to date with your strongest Champions. Putting out your best Defense is key to climbing the Tier rankings.
Once you set your Arena Defense, that team will fight against other players on your behalf. These battles happen automatically, and you won't control each one.
Arena Offense is different: you target another player's Defense, you pick your team, and you go to battle. You control everything.
The Battle tab contains your list of opponents. Arena battles are tough, so make sure you check each team's Champions before entering a battle.
Every Classic Arena battle you do is tracked here. This lets you keep track of which teams gave you trouble, and how you should improve. It's up to you to fill it with victories.
This shows your current Arena Tier, your current points total, and the time remaining until the Ranking Period ends.
And that's it. In the Arena, fighting often and maintaining a strong Arena defense is key - so make sure you stay on top of it.
This tab shows all the Arena Tiers. The more Arena battles you win, the more Arena Points you'll earn, and the higher you'll climb in the Rankings.
Each Tier provides different bonuses to your team for as long as you maintain your position in that Tier.
Ranking also works in periods. You'll also get a bonus reward depending on the Tier in which you finish at the end of each Ranking Period.
And that's not all. Arena battles also give you Medals. Bronze Tiers give Bronze Medals, Silver give Silver, and so on. Higher Tiers also give more of each Medal.
Medals let you unlock incredibly powerful bonuses. You can spend any Medals you earn at the Great Hall to unlock permanent boosts for your Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:tavern/spend-high-rarity-hero/popup: Only sacrifice high Rarity Champions if you're sure you don't need them. Continue anyway?
localizedStrings.l10n:tavern/item-lock-cause?id=HeroInAre: This Champion cannot be sacrified. Occupied Champions, such as those in your Arena Defenses, or at the Sparring Pit, cannot be sacrificed until they are removed.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/battle-hud-d: The arrows above each enemy's head show how your Champion's Affinity matches up against theirs. An Affinity advantage means a more effective attack - more damage, and a higher chance to crit.
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-loading/arena-hint#label: In the Arena, small differences matter. Level up your Champions and upgrade your Artifacts to give yourself an edge.
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-loading/pve-hint#label: The more your Champions fight, the more XP they earn, and the more powerful they become.
localizedStrings.l10n:error-manager/error#description: Something went wrong. Please restart the application and try again. If you continue to experience this error, please don't hesitate to contact our Support Team.
localizedStrings.l10n:wizard/speaker-message/map/message-: You and your champions must fight through his Banner Lords, find him, and see if he has turned to Siroth.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/epilogue/message-1: Having overcome the Castle Guard, the Company Leader called to mind how the Banner Lords had cried out their allegiance to their King but also to Siroth.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/epilogue/message-2: Was the King's warring folly prompted by the will of the Lord of Darkness?
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/epilogue/message-3: Upon interrogation, a fallen Knight confessed that the King had not been seen at the Castle for many a month.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/epilogue/message-4: His orders were being relayed by messenger from his encampment on the eastern front.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/epilogue/message-5: This meant only one thing  the Company would have to pass through the war-torn City of Arnoc.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/prologue/message-1: Eleven generations of peace had reigned between the Kingdom of Kaerok and the Realm of Aravia -
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/prologue/message-2: a peace now shattered by King Tayba's brutal campaign of expansion into the neutral lands between the two kingdoms
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/prologue/message-3: Once revered as a pillar of justice, King Tayba had imposed crushing taxes to finance his war with his former ally, bringing desolation and ruin upon his own people.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/prologue/message-4: Had the king lost all reason?
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/prologue/message-5: On the orders of the Arbiter, the Company set out to persuade him to renounce his folly and wayward policies.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-01/prologue/message-6: Even if it meant storming the very gates of Kaerok Castle
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/epilogue/message-1: After dispatching the lizardmen tainted by the Shadow, the Company waylaid a messenger bearing a missive from the King.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/epilogue/message-2: They demanded that he direct them to the royal encampment.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/epilogue/message-3: Trembling for his life, the emissary pleaded that he knew nothing of such a camp.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/epilogue/message-4: He had only ever received the sealed messages from a hooded knight at the catacombs of the temple of Narbuk.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/epilogue/message-5: Emerging from the sewers, the Company set their compass north-eastward and began a long and arduous trek to the catacombs.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/prologue/message-1: The once glorious city of Arnoc had fallen into ruin, famine and great sorrow.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/prologue/message-2: Peopled by desperate refugees, it had become an unclean place made darker by unknown horrors spawned in the encroaching Shadow.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/prologue/message-3: To go through it safely would take days - to go round it much longer. So the Company agreed to pass beneath it.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-02/prologue/message-4: They would venture into the foul city sewers, albeit risking the known danger of intruding on the territory of the lizardmen
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/epilogue/message-1: The Company crashed into a chamber to find King Tayba strapped to a chair, his captors forcing a brew down his throat.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/epilogue/message-2: They made short work of the aggressors then cut the King from his binds.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/epilogue/message-3: "I have been bewitched," he began in rasping breaths, "forced to declare war on Aravia..."
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/epilogue/message-4: Then, handing them his royal signet, he said:
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/epilogue/message-5: "Ask Queen Eva forgiveness for my forced betrayal thank her for giving refuge to my people and request her help to find the cause of this... this Shadow"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/prologue/message-1: At last, they arrived at Narbuk where the temple was now consecrated to the cult of Siroth.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/prologue/message-2: Guided by their torches, they entered the catacombs where the wind howled with the anguished screams of the restless dead.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-03/prologue/message-3: As they sank deeper into the vaulted galleries, a voice on the wind became ever more distinct, now echoing words of protest, now prayers to Lumaya, the Goddess of Light.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/epilogue/message-1: The ugly truth of the Dark Elves was now known.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/epilogue/message-2: Preying on the desperation of the refugees, they had offered two paths
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/epilogue/message-3: the rich man's path, offering safe passage to Felwin's Gate - and the poor man's path leading to the belly of the Dragon.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/epilogue/message-4: The Company blazed ahead to meet the elven Queen of Aravia, an ancestral ally of Kaerok.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/epilogue/message-5: Known for her exceptional beauty, she was also a famed mistress of the old magic.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/epilogue/message-6: So our heroes joined the torrent of hopeful exiles traveling eastward, to the promise of sanctuary among the High Elves.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/prologue/message-1: To gain entrance into Aravia, they would have to pass through the dark wood to Felwin's Gate.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/prologue/message-2: After a three-day trek, they reached the edge of Durham Forest, home of the Dark Elves.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/prologue/message-3: The Elves promised safe passage to those who would pay the toll.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/prologue/message-4: Showing them the signet of the King, the Company claimed right of way as bearers of the monarch's word.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-04/prologue/message-5: But the Dark Elves recognized neither King nor Queen, and attempted to take their toll in blood...
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/epilogue/message-1: They emerged victorious on the other side, and opened wide the colossal gate to let through the multitude.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/epilogue/message-2: Amid great acclaim, the Company followed the road north toward the Palace of Aravia
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/epilogue/message-3: But before leaving the gate, a wounded Skinwalker seized hold of one of them and growled:
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/epilogue/message-4: "See what you do, not good! We bar gate for reason. None can help them now"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/prologue/message-1: Arriving at the snow-clad moor that sloped down to Felwin's gate, the Company surveyed the grim scene before them
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/prologue/message-3: human folk, lizardmen, elven the many peoples of Teleria, all camped in the frozen mud outside the battlements of the great gate, now barred.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/prologue/message-4: Ogryn and Skinwalker guards were denying them entry, telling them to clear off back to their homelands.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-05/prologue/message-5: The Company agreed to force their way through and unbar the passage.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-1: They reeled in horror at what they found.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-2: Having exchanged the grace of the Eldar for the dark power of the Shadow, the Queen had mutated into a malicious sorceress.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-3: It was she who had betrayed the King, had fomented the war between Kaerok and Aravia...
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-4: But to what end? What bargain had she struck?
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-5: The Company now realized that the Skinwalkers had barred Felwin's Gate for good reason!
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-6: Donning their cloaks, the heroes fled the palace.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/epilogue/message-7: They joined the refugees travelling under the escort of the Sacred Order, to uncover what dire fate Queen Eva had laid down for them.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-1: Elven lords and ladies welcomed the travelers with honey cake and mead.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-2: They told them they would be led to their new home on the other side of Tilshire.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-3: Wasting no time, the Company hailed the Elven Guard to demand audience with the Queen.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-4: They offered to give her news of her friend and ally, King Tayba.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-5: The guard promptly returned with his chief who said, perhaps too affably:
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-6: "The Queen bids you welcome and friendship. She awaits you in her rooms."
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-06/prologue/message-7: Our heroes advanced nonetheless with caution into the magnificent palatial hall.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/epilogue/message-1: The Company were in two minds. Should they risk tailing the Necromancer knowing they were outnumbered by the Sacred Order?
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/epilogue/message-2: Or should they cut through the treacherous mountain and take him by surprise at Valdemar Strait?
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/epilogue/message-3: Their dilemma was soon resolved by the circling presence of a great white eagle.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/epilogue/message-4: It carried a message from the Arbiter telling them to make haste, that a Dark Mass was in preparation in the Deadlands.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/epilogue/message-5: So our heroes took the shorter but perilous mountain route.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/epilogue/message-6: However, slowed in their tracks by a terrible blizzard, they arrived at Valdemar Strait as Bad-el-Kazar set sail.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/prologue/message-1: Stepping inside the township of Tilshire, the Company realized they had entered a trap, for the gates were slammed shut and barred behind them!
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/prologue/message-2: The people - visibly entranced - were herded by Orcish guards to an inner court where Bad-el-Kazar, the dark Necromancer, was lording his power with the scepter of Siroth.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/prologue/message-3: Sensing the presence of stronger spirits, the Necromancer suddenly roared out:
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-07/prologue/message-4: "Guards! Arrest them! They are the Queen killers! Give no quarter should they resist!"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/epilogue/message-1: As Bad-el-Kazar crashed to the deck, a black book of spells tumbled from his gown.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/epilogue/message-2: It bore arcane writings and an image of a horrifying ritual that was to begin with the dark mass.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/epilogue/message-3: Meanwhile, freed from the Necromancer's somber grip, the surviving knights of the Sacred Order were released from their demonic trance.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/epilogue/message-4: A knight by the name of Kenric begged forgiveness for his Order's wrongdoings while under the Necromancer's yoke.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/epilogue/message-5: He swore to restore their honor, and to save the bewitched folk from committing their shards to Siroth.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/prologue/message-1: Our heroes commandeered a fast ship and gave chase sailing three sheets to the wind.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/prologue/message-2: They were soon coursing in the wake of the enemy vessel.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-08/prologue/message-3: And, as the sun touched the horizon, they came broadside and boarded for a final confrontation with Bad-el-Kazar.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/epilogue/message-1: The Company announced to the multitude that Bad-el-Kazar the Necromancer was dead.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/epilogue/message-2: But to their horror, as the incantation to Siroth resumed, they realized the souls of the congregation were still corrupted.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/epilogue/message-3: It was then that the Arbiter appeared with news from the Knights of the Sacred Order.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/epilogue/message-4: They were assembling at Godfrey's Crossing in a final bid to destroy the Demon Priests of the Hallowed Halls.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/epilogue/message-5: "Go forth, and make haste, brave Champions," she intoned, "I will stay and purify these souls!"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/prologue/message-1: The hot, barren Deadlands were littered with ruins that bore witness to an erstwhile time when this land was fertile - before the Brimstone Dragon came and scorched the earth.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/prologue/message-2: After three days of fighting rabid beasts and barbarian patrols, the Company at last came to the ancient temple of Lumaya, now the destination of a dark ritual.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-09/prologue/message-3: Folk of every race were being driven in droves by Barbarians through the great temple gates to the sound of a deep, throbbing drone.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/epilogue/message-1: They passed to the other side where the army of the Sacred Order had been decimated.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/epilogue/message-2: One of the heroes picked out Kenric among the dying.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/epilogue/message-3: He called his brothers in arms around him, and all four fell to one knee.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/epilogue/message-4: "O valiant knights, in your crusade against evil you have redeemed your Order," he hailed.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/epilogue/message-5: He then lifted his eyes to the sky. "Fear not, noble Lords. May your souls ascend to the light of Lumaya!"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/epilogue/message-6: The Company then pressed on, arms at the ready, toward the Hallowed Halls to claim their vengeance.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/prologue/message-1: At Godfrey's Crossing where the Deadlands met the gorge of the Hallowed Halls, they came upon a horrific sight to behold.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/prologue/message-2: The remains of a fallen army were scattered on the far side of the bridge that separated the two territories.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-10/prologue/message-3: Realizing the Sacred Order must have fallen into an ambush, the Company proceeded with great caution to the crossing.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-1: "Mortal scum!" roared the Demon Priest as he prepared to deliver his final assault.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-2: "Dead heroes cannot change the fate of this world!"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-3: But, in a tremendous blaze of might and fury, the Company swiftly dealt a crushing blow.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-4: As he lay mortally wounded by the Fires of Hell, in a strange, demonic voice, he howled:
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-5: "Fools! You do not see what I see..."
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-6: Then, in one last fiendish effort, he thrust out a hand and conjured a vision in flames of hellfire.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/epilogue/message-7: It was the image of their death!
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/prologue/message-1: Upon arriving at the Hallowed Halls, to the great surprise of our valiant heroes, the chief of the Knights Revenant held out a hand in friendship.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/prologue/message-2: "Great warriors," he bellowed, from the hall steps, "let us join hands in blood! Your valor will receive far greater reward in the design of Siroth than in the failing light of Lumaya!"
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/prologue/message-3: The spell of the Shadow was at its most potent in these halls.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-11/prologue/message-4: But our heroes, with hearts still pure and noble, remained loyal to the righteous Light and offered only one answer
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-1: By the light of Lumaya, the Company vanquished the guardians of Siroth and the fell demon Kivos.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-2: But alas, it soon became clear that the Priest's prophecy would be fulfilled!
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-3: For only the combined force of their shards could unleash enough power to seal the dark portal.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-4: Our heroes bravely stepped forward and, together, offered the ultimate sacrifice to cast out the Shadow from the world!
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-5: But wait, O Champion the story endeth not here.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-6: For the portal will open again, Siroth will return, and the Shadow will loom larger.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-7: Until that day comes, return to Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-8: Hone your skills, and seek out new champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/epilogue/message-9: You will need them ALL soon enough...
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/prologue/message-1: Was the Demon Priest's sinister prophecy but a sham to prevent them from blazing a trail to the source of evil?
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/prologue/message-2: Whatever the outcome, our four Heroes had no choice but to approach the Brimstone Path that led to the very source of the Shadow.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/prologue/message-3: Still they strove onward, battling their way through hellfire to the Brimstone Gate.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/prologue/message-4: This, the portal of Siroth, was sucking the living light from Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:storyline/loc-12/prologue/message-5: Here they would have to end the corruption and restore the balance between the forces of darkness and light...

localizedStrings.l10n:map/storyline-info#description:
Beat Campaign stages to earn stars and win rewards. The better you perform on each stage, the more stars you earn, and the more Rewards you get. Earn every Star on each difficulty for an extra special reward.

Track your progress with the bar at the bottom of the screen on the Campaign Map.
Each difficulty - Normal, Hard, Brutal, and Nightmare - has its own progress bar and Rewards.

localizedStrings.l10n:hero-stats-decription/StatKindId?id: Influences the chance of successfully applying Debuffs on enemy targets. Make sure your ACC is much higher than your enemy's RES to give yourself the best chance of landing Debuffs.
Determines how much damage a Champion's ATK-based Skills will deal. Unless otherwise stated, all Skills scale off ATK.
Defines how often a Champion's Skills will land as Critical Hits.
Defines the amount of additional damage dealt by Critical Hits on top of a Skill's base damage. 150% C. DMG will mean a Critical Hit will deal 250% damage (100% base damage + 150% crit damage).
Defines the amount of additional heal dealt on top of a Skill's base heal.
Mitigates incoming damage from enemy attacks. The higher a Champion's DEF stat, the less HP will be lost from an attack.
Determines how much damage a Champion can take before they are defeated.
Influences the chance of successfully resisting an enemy Champion's Debuffs. If you have high RES your opponent will need a lot of ACC to apply Debuffs.
Determines how quickly a Champion fills their Turn Meter. Your team will move in order of SPD, fastest Champion first. A Champion with 200 SPD will move twice as often as a Champion with 100 SPD.

localizedStrings.l10n:bank/subscriptions/info-text-androi: Payment will be charged to your account at the time of purchase, unless a free Trial period is activated. In those cases, payment will be charged during the last 24 hours of the free Trial. Cards will automatically renew (at the duration/price selected) unless cancelled at least 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. Active Raid Cards can be cancelled from the Account section of the Google Play Store after puchase. Cancelled Cards will retain the bonuses until the end of the active period. By confirming the purchase, you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
localizedStrings.l10n:bank/subscriptions/info-text-ios#la: Raid Cards are a subscription purchase. Payment will be charged to your iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period. The account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period at the price selected. Subscriptions may be managed and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to Account Settings after purchase. In case of activating a free trial, payment will be charged during the last 24 hours of the free Trial. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when a Raid Card purchase is confirmed. Once auto-renew is turned off, subscriptions will retain the bonuses until the end of the active period.
localizedStrings.l10n:summon-drop-rate/generic-descriptio:
The odds of summoning a Champion of a certain Rarity depends on the type of Shard. Every Champion of the same Rarity has an equal chance of being summoned, except when Targeted Champion Boosts are active. Targeted Champion Boosts increase the chances of summoning specific Champions.
<color=#ffe87d>The following Champions cannot be summoned from Sacred Shards:</color> Shaman, Jizoh, High Khatun, Yaga the Insatiable, Dark Athel, Dark Elhain, Lordly Legionary, Scyl of the Drakes, Tainix Hateflower, Ghrush the Mangler, and Cleopterix.

localizedStrings.l10n:battlefield/battleground-info#descr: Faction Wars will pit Faction against Faction in a fight for honor and glory. With their strongholds besieged by warring alliances, each Faction must rise up and liberate their lands. And with the stakes so high, only Champions born of the Faction will be willing to put their lives on the line to defend their kind. Rally your Champions. Gather the strongest each Faction has to offer, and set forth to battle. SCROLL TO READ HOW FACTION WARS WILL WORK - Each Faction will have their own dedicated location that they must liberate. - Only Champions from that Faction are able to fight for you at that location. - Each location will contain multiple Stages that your Champions must beat. - Each location will also contain tough new Bosses that develop and get harder as you progress. - Like Potion Keeps, each Faction's location will only be open on certain days. What does this mean for you? Prepare. Train teams of Champions from each Faction and ready them for the wars to come. Hint: You'll need to rely on all your Champions. Do not sacrifice Champions unless you have adequate replacements from the same Faction.

localizedStrings.l10n:storyline-map/area-stars-info#descr:
Beat Campaign Stages to earn stars and win Rewards. The better you perform on each Stage, the more stars you earn, and the more Rewards you get. Earn every star on each difficulty for an extra special Reward.

Track your progress with the bar at the bottom of the screen on the Campaign Map.
Each difficulty - Normal, Hard, Brutal, and Nightmare - has its own progress bar and Rewards.
localizedStrings.l10n:fraction-wars-map/area-stars-info#d:
Raid each Faction's Crypt to earn special items - Glyphs.

Glyphs are used to enchant your Artifacts and upgrade their substats, making them even more powerful.

You can also earn stars in Faction Wars to get your hands on extra Rewards. The better you perform on each Stage, the more stars you earn, and the more Rewards you get. And if you earn 3 Stars on every Stage with every Faction, you'll get a special Champion as a reward - <color=#F3BC02>Lydia the Deathsiren</color>. Track your progress with the bar at the bottom of the screen on the Faction Wars Map.

localizedStrings.l10n:amazon-prime-overlay/info#message:
Amazon Prime Content will be available from December 16th, 2019, 17:00 UTC until April 5th, 2020, 17:00 UTC, with 8 different Content Drops available within that period.

- Each Content Drop will be available for 2 weeks. 

- Each Content Drop will be available exclusively to Amazon Prime users. Learn more at Amazon.com/raidsl.

- Players must collect each Content Drop manually after loading the game. Amazon Prime accounts must be active to be able to collect Content Drops.

- Each Amazon Prime account can only be used to collect Content Drops with one Raid account.

- Only the first Amazon Prime account connected to each Raid account can be used to collect Content Drops from that account.

- All content is only available in the mobile version of Raid: Shadow Legends, and is not claimable while playing Raid: Shadow Legends on Mac or PC via Plarium Play.

Summoning Rates for Shards:
- Ancient Shards: 91.5% for Rare Champions, 8% for Epic Champions, 0.5% for Legendary Champions.
- Void Shards: 91.5% for Rare Champions, 8% for Epic Champions, 0.5% for Legendary Champions.

Disclaimer: This promotion is not available in India, China, Taiwan, South Korea, Vietnam, or embargoed regions.

localizedStrings.l10n:battle-pass/wizard/message-1#label: Battle Passes give you a special series of Challenges to earn Battle Pass Points and win amazing and unique Rewards.
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-pass/wizard/message-2#label: <color=#ffe87d>Complete Challenges to earn Battle Pass Points and increase your Battle Pass Level.</color> You'll win new Rewards every time you level up your Battle Pass.
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-pass/wizard/message-3#label: There are two different sets of Rewards available depending on your type of Battle Pass - Core or Gold. Everyone can get Core Rewards, but <color=#ffe87d>only those with the Gold Pass can claim Gold Rewards.</color>
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-pass/wizard/message-4#label: Daily Challenges are open to everybody. <color=#ffe87d>Complete Daily Challenges to earn Battle Pass Points</color> and start claiming your Rewards.
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-pass/wizard/message-5#label: <color=#ffe87d>Get the Gold Pass</color> and complete Weekly Challenges to earn <color=#ffe87d>even more Battle Pass</color> Points and win <color=#ffe87d>even better Rewards.</color> Youll even get an extra Reward if you manage to complete all the Weekly Challenges.
localizedStrings.l10n:battle-pass/wizard/message-6#label: You can win many exclusive Rewards - including Battle Pass Avatars, Gems, Silver, Chickens, and even Champions! Good luck on your quest.

localizedStrings.l10n:arena3x3/locked#description:
Tag Team Arena (or Tag Arena!) takes Arena battles to the next level. You'll be tasked with assembling 3 separate teams to fight your rivals across a Series of battles.

Each Tag Team fight consists of a Series of 3 battles. The first player to win 2 battles wins the Series, so be sure to put your strongest foot forward.

Tag Arena and Classic Arena each have their own Offense and Defense teams, as well as their own Tiers and Rankings - meaning you'll have to work your way up the ladder in both Arena modes separately.

In Tag Arena, each Battle won or lost in a Series decides how many Tag Arena Points youll get at the end - so youll want to win all 3 Battles to guarantee a steady points gain.

Keep your teams strong if you want to maintain your position.

Like in Classic Arena, the number of Tag Arena Points you have determines your Tag Team Arena Tier - Bronze, Silver, or Gold.

localizedStrings.l10n:arena3x3/wizard/message-1#label: Welcome to Tag Team Arena, where you'll need to assemble 3 separate teams of Champions to fight your rivals across a Series of 3 Arena battles.
localizedStrings.l10n:arena3x3/wizard/message-2#label: You'll earn Points for every battle you win in a Series, so you'll need 3 strong teams to climb to higher Tiers. The progress bar shows your position within your current Tier and if you'll move up or down Tiers at Tier placement.
localizedStrings.l10n:arena3x3/wizard/message-3#label: You'll also earn Gold Bars from Tag Arena Battles, which can be exchanged for valuable items at the Bazaar. Higher Tier battles give you more Gold Bars, so you'll want to climb the rankings for better rewards.
localizedStrings.l10n:arena3x3/wizard/message-4#label: Your Tag Arena Tier determines which Slots are open at the Bazaar. The higher your Tier, the more Slots are unlocked, and the better items you'll have available to you.

localizedStrings.l10n:tower-teaser-overlay/info#descripti:
Guarded by some of Teleria's toughest Bosses, the Doom Tower will put your Champions and your strategy to the test.

With 120 Floors, 12 Secret Rooms, 11 Minibosses, and 1 Final Boss, the journey to the top of the tower will be tough - but the Rewards will be worth it.

You'll have two difficulties to beat, and a limited time to make the climb - at which point the Tower resets and you start ascending again.

New Bosses, new challenges, and many unknown enemies stand between you and glory. 

Train your warriors, for the Doom Tower is coming.

localizedStrings.l10n:forge/chances/info-overlay/sections:
Using a Type Charm will increase the odds of crafting that Type of Artifact. At the same time, the odds of crafting each of the other Artifact Types will be reduced equally across all Types.

For example, if you use a Shield Charm, you will have 33.33% chance of crafting a Shield, while the odds of crafting each of the other Artifact Types will be reduced to 13.33% each.
Each Artifact can have the following Primary Stats and Substats:

* There are actually 11 possible Substats available, but one Substat will be excluded from the options after the Primary Stat is decided - since no Artifact can have the same Stat as both a Primary Stat and a Substat.

<color=#ffe87d>How Primary Stats and Substats are decided when crafting:</color>
- Stats are random and decided in stages: First the Primary Stat is decided, then each Substat is decided one-by-one (depending on the Rarity of the Artifact and how many Substats it may have).
- Each available Stat at any stage has equal odds of being chosen. For example, if there are 10 Stats available, each has a 10% chance of being chosen.
- No Artifact can have the same Stat as both a Primary Stat and a Substat, and cannot have multiple of the same Substat. As such, the number of Stats available decreases with each additional Substat an Artifact may have, and the chances of each Substat will subsequently increase.

<color=#ffe87d>How Substat Charms work:</color>
- Substat Charms increase the odds of getting a specific Substat. You will have a 50% chance of getting your desired Stat as the first Substat on your Artifact. This increased chance applies only to the first Substat.
- The selected Substat may still be chosen as the Artifact's Primary Stat (if available for that Artifact), in which case it won't be available as a Substat.
- The selected Substat will be excluded from the possible Substat options from any second, third, or fourth Substats the Artifact may have - even if not selected as the first Substat.
Default odds per Substat (For first Substat only)

localizedStrings.l10n:summon-drop-rate/mercy-system-activ:
<color=#ffe87d>The Mercy System</color> activates after you summon a certain number of Shards without getting a Champion of a specific Rarity.

Once activated, the Mercy System increases your odds of summoning Champions of a specific Rarity with every consecutive Shard you summon of that Type. For example, after summoning 20 Void Shards without getting an Epic Champion, your chance of getting an Epic Champion from Void Shards will increase by 2% with every Shard - until you get an Epic Champion, at which point the odds will reset back to the default chances for that Rarity.
localizedStrings.l10n:summon-drop-rate/mercy-system-expla:
- Your Mercy counters are tracked individually for each Type of Shard - meaning even if you Summon a Legendary Champion from a Sacred Shard, it won't affect your Mercy counter for Ancient Shards.
- After you successfully summon either an Epic or Legendary Champion, your Mercy counter will reset for that Rarity from that Type of Shard and your chances will reset to those displayed in the <color=#ffe87d>Default Summoning Chances</color> table.
- For Ancient and Void Shards, the Mercy counters for both Epic and Legendary Champions are tracked individually. This means even if you get a Legendary Champion, it won't reset your Mercy counter for Epic Champions if you've already gone 20+ Shards without summoning an Epic.
- The chance increases are additive, not multiplicative (meaning an increase of 2% to an 8% chance will take it to 10%).

localizedStrings.l10n:summon-drop-rate/mercy-system-expla:
- Your Mercy counters are tracked individually for each Type of Shard - meaning even if you Summon a Legendary Champion from a Sacred Shard, it won't affect your Mercy counter for Ancient Shards.
- After you successfully summon either an Epic or Legendary Champion, your Mercy counter will reset for that Rarity from that Type of Shard and your chances will reset to those displayed in the <color=#ffe87d>Default Summoning Chances</color> table.
- For Ancient and Void Shards, the Mercy counters for both Epic and Legendary Champions are tracked individually. This means even if you get a Legendary Champion, it won't reset your Mercy counter for Epic Champions if you've already gone 20+ Shards without summoning an Epic.
- The chance increases are additive, not multiplicative (meaning an increase of 2% to an 8% chance will take it to 10%).
- As a new player, your Mercy System for Ancient Shards will activate early to help you summon your first Legendary Champion from Ancient Shards. Your Mercy system will activate after your first Ancient Shard, and your chances of summoning a Legendary from Ancient Shards will increase by 20% of the previous chance (0.5% on the first, 0.6% on the second, 0.72% on the third, and so on) with every consecutive Ancient Shard  until you summon a Legendary Champion, at which point your odds of getting a Legendary Champion from Ancient Shards will reset to those displayed in the <color=#ffe87d>Default Summoning Chances</color> table.

- Your Mercy counters are tracked individually for each Type of Shard - meaning even if you Summon a Legendary Champion from a Sacred Shard, it won't affect your Mercy counter for Ancient Shards.
- After you successfully summon either an Epic or Legendary Champion, your Mercy counter will reset for that Rarity from that Type of Shard and your chances will reset to those displayed in the <color=#ffe87d>Default Summoning Chances</color> table.
- For Ancient and Void Shards, the Mercy counters for both Epic and Legendary Champions are tracked individually. This means even if you get a Legendary Champion, it won't reset your Mercy counter for Epic Champions if you've already gone 20+ Shards without summoning an Epic.
- The chance increases are additive, not multiplicative (meaning an increase of 2% to an 8% chance will take it to 10%).
- As a new player, your Mercy System for Sacred Shards will activate early to help you summon your first Legendary Champion from Sacred Shards. Your Mercy system will activate after your first Sacred Shard, and your chances of summoning a Legendary from Sacred Shards will double (6% on the first, 12% on the second, 24% on the third, and so on) with every consecutive Sacred Shard  until you summon a Legendary Champion, at which point your odds of getting a Legendary Champion from Sacred Shards will reset to those displayed in the <color=#ffe87d>Default Summoning Chances</color> table.

Years bent to evil purpose have left a darkness about them, and their fight to regain their lost honor has only just begun.

localizedStrings.l10n:actor-contoller/bosses-special-effe:
Summons Mirror Copies of all enemies onto <color=#1ee600>Astranyx</color>s team every time her <color=#1ee600>Dark Energy</color> counter reaches 5. 

Also places a <color=#1ee600>[Perfect Veil]</color> buff on <color=#1ee600>Astranyx the Dark Fae</color> for 3 turns every time her <color=#1ee600>Dark Energy</color> counter reaches 5. 

[<color=#1ee600>Astranyx</color>s <color=#1ee600>Dark Energy</color> counter resets after it reaches 5.]

Each <color=#1ee600>[Sky Bond]</color> buff increases <color=#ffe87d>Grythion</color>'s: ATK by 5%; C. RATE by 3%; C. DMG by 5%; SPD by 2.5.
Can stack up to 20 <color=#1ee600>[Sky Bond]</color> buffs. <color=#1ee600>[Sky Bond]</color> buffs cannot be blocked or removed.

Starts the battle with a divine shield. While active, the shield reduces the damage Fyro receives by 80% and prevents Fyro from receiving any Debuffs or being affected by other Skill effects. This shield cannot be removed by Skills that remove Buffs. Each hit Fyro takes decreases the strength of the shield. The shield will be broken when hit enough times. The shield regenerates every turn.
