localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500121#static: Increases damage inflicted by 5% when attacking with full HP
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500123#static: Increases damage inflicted to targets under <color=#1ee600>[Shield]</color> buffs by 25%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500124#static: Increases damage inflicted by 5% when attacking with 50% HP or less
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500131#static: Increases damage inflicted to targets with less than 40% HP by 8%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500132#static: Heals by 5% of damage inflicted when attacking with 50% HP or less
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500133#static: Increases SPD by 6 for each enemy killed by this Champion. Stacks across each round in a battle, up to 18 SPD
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500134#static: Increases damage inflicted by 8% for the first hit on each enemy
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500141#static: Increases damage inflicted by 6% when attacking targets with higher MAX HP
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500142#static: Increases damage inflicted by 5% for each dead ally. Stacks up to 10%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500143#static: Has a 30% chance of decreasing the cooldown of a random Skill by 1 turn if the damage inflicted by a Skill exceeds 30% of the target's MAX HP. Occurs once per turn
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500144#static: Increases damage inflicted to targets with <color=#1ee600>[Stun]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Sleep]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[True Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Freeze]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Petrification]</color> debuffs by 12%.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500151#static: Increases the damage inflicted by this Champion's default Skill by 2% each time it is used during battle. Stacks across each round in a battle, up to 10%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500152#static: Increases damage inflicted by 6% in the Arena and 3% in all other locations for each enemy killed by this Champion in battle. Stacks across each round in a battle, up to 12%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500153#static: Places a <color=#1ee600>[Shield]</color> buff on this Champion for 1 turn when this Champion kills an enemy(except Boss' minions). The value of the <color=#1ee600>[Shield]</color> is equal to 15% of this Champion's MAX HP. Occurs once per turn
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500154#static: Increases damage inflicted by 4% for each debuff on this Champion. Stacks up to 12%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500161#static: Has a 60% chance of inflicting bonus damage when attacking. Bonus damage is equal to 10% of the target Champion's MAX HP or 4% of the target's MAX HP when attacking Bosses. Bonus damage can only occur once per Skill and does not count as an extra hit.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500162#static: Has a 50% chance of ignoring 25% of the target's DEF. For Skills that ignore DEF, this 25% is in addition to the amount ignored by the Skill.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500163#static: Has a 30% chance of inflicting bonus damage when attacking. Bonus damage is equal to 7.5% of the target Champion's MAX HP or 3% of the target's MAX HP when attacking Bosses. Bonus damage can occur on each hit of a Skill, but does not count as an extra hit.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500221#static: Decreases damage received from AoE attacks by 5%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500222#static: Increases the amount of healing and the value of <color=#1ee600>[Shield]</color> buffs this Champion receives by 5%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500223#static: Decreases the damage received by 10% if this Champion has <color=#1ee600>[Stun]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Sleep]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[True Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Freeze]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Petrification]</color> debuffs.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500224#static: Decreases the damage received by this Champion by 8% when this Champion is hit with a critical hit
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500231#static: Heals this Champion by 6% of their MAX HP each time an enemy is healed. Occurs once per turn.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500232#static: Has a 50% chance to remove 1 random debuff from this Champion when they lose 25% of their MAX HP or more from a single enemy Skill
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500233#static: Heals this Champion by 10% of their MAX HP when they kill an enemy target(except Boss' minions).Cooldown: 1 turn
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500234#static: Has a 30% chance of placing a <color=#1ee600>[Block Debuffs]</color> buff on this Champion for 1 turn when <color=#1ee600>[Stun]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Sleep]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[True Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Freeze]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Petrification]</color> debuffs expire on this Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500241#static: Increases Ally RES by 5 for each buff placed on them by this Champion
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500242#static: Reduces the damage this Champion receives from a specific enemy by 0.75% with each hit taken from that enemy. Damage reduction stacks up to 6% for each enemy
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500243#static: Has a 60% chance of placing a <color=#1ee600>[Leech]</color> debuff for 1 turn when placing <color=#1ee600>[Stun]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Sleep]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[True Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Freeze]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Petrification]</color> debuffs.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500244#static: Increases RES by 10 for each debuff on this Champion. Stacks up to 30
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500251#static: Decreases the damage an ally receives from the first enemy hit in each round by 20%. This Champion will receive that damage instead
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500252#static: Has a 50% chance of increasing the Turn Meter by 15% when an ally is attacked with a critical hit. Will only increase the Turn Meter once if an ally receives multiple critical hits from a single Skill
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500253#static: Has a 50% chance to counterattack when this Champion loses 25% of their MAX HP or more from a single enemy Skill
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500254#static: Has a 20% chance to counterattack an enemy when they apply a <color=#1ee600>[Stun]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Sleep]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[True Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Freeze]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Petrification]</color>,or <color=#1ee600>[Sheep]</color>debuff on an ally. Cooldown: 1 turn
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500262#static: Decreases the damage all allies receive by 5%. This Champion will receive that damage instead
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500263#static: Increases the chances of placing a <color=#1ee600>[Stun]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Sleep]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Freeze]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[True Fear]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Provoke]</color>,or <color=#1ee600>[Sheep]</color> debufffrom Skills or Artifacts by 5%

localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500322#static: Increases the value of <color=#1ee600>[Shield]</color> buffs this Champion casts by 5%
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500323#static: Heals this Champion by 10% of their MAX HP the first time an enemy is killed in each round
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500324#static: Increases ACC by 20 when this Champion has no Skills on cooldown
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500331#static: Increases the amount of healing and the value of <color=#1ee600>[Shield]</color> buffs placed by this Champion by 10% if the target ally has 40% HP or less
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500332#static: Has a 30% chance of increasing the Turn Meter by 10% when a <color=#ffe87d>buff</color> cast by this Champion is removed or expires
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500333#static: Increases ACC by 4 for each enemy alive. Stacks up to 16
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500334#static: Has a 30% chance of increasing the Turn Meter by 10% when a <color=#ffe87d>debuff</color> cast by this Champion is removed or expires

localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500343#static: Increases the Base Stat Set Bonuses of all Artifact Sets that increase Base Stats by 15%. This increase is multiplicative, not additive.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500344#static: Decreases the target's Turn Meter when this Champion hits them with the default Skill for the first time. Decreases the Turn Meter by 20% with single-target Skills and by 5% with AoE Skills. Occurs once per target.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500351#static:
Has a 30% chance to extend the duration of any buff cast by this Champion by 1 turn.

It will not extend <color=#1ee600>[Block Damage]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Unkillable]</color>, <color=#1ee600>[Revive on Death]</color>, or <color=#1ee600>[Taunt]</color> buffs.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500352#static: Increases SPD by 8 for each dead ally. Stacks up to 24
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500353#static:

localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500362#static: Increases this Champion's Turn Meter by 20% whenever an ally hero drops below 25% HP
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=500363#static: Increases the Turn Meter fill rate by 2.5% for each active debuff cast by this Champion. Stacks up to 10%.
localizedStrings.l10n:skill/description?id=7000001#static:
Attacks 1 enemy. Any ally Sheep will join this attack.

Has a 50% chance of removing the <color=#1eff30>[Sheep]</color> debuff from this Champion after attacking.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161101#static:
To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Magic Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Magic Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Magic Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161102#static:
To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Force Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Force Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Force Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161103#static:

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161104#static:
To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Spirit Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161105#static:
Clearing Dungeons on <color=#ffe87d>Auto</color> saves time.

You will need <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Keep</color> to Ascend Champions of <color=#ffe87d>any Affinity</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Unlike other Potion Dungeons, the Arcane Keep is always open.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161106#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161201#static:
Every Boss has strengths and weaknesses. You'll have to come up with a strategy and build the right team to defeat each of them.

The Force Guardian has a passive that grants him extremely high <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>. Although some rarer Champions with Ignore DEF Skills can make this fight easier, the safest way to victory is simply by decreasing his DEF.

Choose a Champion who can place a <color=#ffe87d>[Decrease DEF] debuff</color> and defeat the <color=#ffe87d>Force Guardian</color>
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161202#static:
To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Magic Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Magic Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Magic Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161206#static:
The Boss of the Dragon's Lair, Hellrazor, has a Secret Skill, <color=#ffe87d>Scorch</color>.

When unlocked, Hellrazor will change stance in preparation to strike. Scorch will unleash a devastating AOE attack that places a <color=#ffe87d>[Stun] debuff</color> on all enemies for 1 turn. However, <color=#ffe87d>Scorch</color> can be locked and hidden again if Hellrazor takes enough damage while preparing to attack. 

Choose high-damage Champions and prevent Hellrazor from successfully launching his <color=#ffe87d>Scorch</color> attack.

Hint: If you're struggling to do enough damage, take Champions that can place <color=#ffe87d>[Decrease DEF]</color> or <color=#ffe87d>[Weaken] debuffs</color>, as well as <color=#ffe87d>[Increase ATK] buffs</color> to amplify the damage you deal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161207#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161301#static:
The Boss of the <color=#ffe87d>Magic Keep</color> protects herself with a powerful <color=#ffe87d>[Shield]</color>. 

Breaking the <color=#ffe87d>[Shield]</color> works, but it is slow and inefficient.

See if you can use one of your Champions' Skills to <color=#ffe87d>remove the [Shield] buff directly</color>. 

Or better yet, <color=#ffe87d>steal it for yourself!</color>
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=161302#static:
The Boss of the <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Keep</color> has the ability to heal herself, prolonging the battle and giving her more chances to kill off your Champions. 

Find a Champion with a Skill that places a <color=#ffe87d>[Heal Reduction] debuff</color> on her to shut her healing down.

Choose Champions with Skills that have remove Debuffs, or even use a <color=#ffe87d>[Block Debuffs] buff</color> to prevent the Debuffs in the first place.

Learning to counter the Boss' mechanics gives you a fighting chance of success.

Challenge the mighty dragon Hellrazor for glory, honor, and loot!

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162101#static:
Upgrading an <color=#ffe87d>Artifact</color> improves its <color=#ffe87d>primary stat</color> bonus. Further upgrades unlock and improve <color=#ffe87d>substats</color> at key milestone levels.

Rarer Artifacts have more <color=#ffe87d>innate substats</color>, meaning their potential strength is much higher when fully upgraded.

Upgrade any Artifact to Level 4 to unlock a new substat or improve an existing one.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162102#static:
Now that you've seen the true potential of <color=#ffe87d>Artifacts</color>, use your <color=#ffe87d>Silver</color> wisely and upgrade some of your strongest Artifacts. 

Hitting <color=#ffe87d>Level 4</color> is particularly important, because <color=#ffe87d>Level 4</color> is when the first <color=#ffe87d>substat</color> is unlocked (or improved, if the Artifact has at least 1 innate substat).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162103#static:
Now that you've seen the true potential of <color=#ffe87d>Artifacts</color>, use your <color=#ffe87d>Silver</color> wisely and upgrade some of your strongest Artifacts. 

Hitting <color=#ffe87d>Level 4</color> is particularly important, because <color=#ffe87d>Level 4</color> is when the first <color=#ffe87d>substat</color> is unlocked (or improved, if the Artifact has at least 1 innate substat).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162104#static:
You can equip Champions with <color=#ffe87d>more than one Artifact Set</color>. 

Effective combinations of Sets can make a huge difference in how strong a Champion is.

Artifact Set Bonuses <color=#ffe87d>stack</color>, meaning their effects are cumulative and add together. 

You can equip a Champion with up to 6 Artifacts. One Champion could have up to three 2-Sets, or one 2-Set and a 4-Set depending on how you want to build them.

Try equipping a Champion with <color=#ffe87d>one 2-Set</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162105#static:
You can equip Champions with <color=#ffe87d>more than one Artifact Set</color>. 

Effective combinations of Sets can make a huge difference in how strong a Champion is.

Artifact Set Bonuses <color=#ffe87d>stack</color>, meaning their effects are cumulative and add together. 

You can equip a Champion with up to 6 Artifacts. One Champion could have up to three 2-Sets, or one 2-Set and a 4-Set depending on how you want to build them.

You can shore up different weaknesses, or double up on one type of Set to specialize further. 

Try equipping a Champion with <color=#ffe87d>two 2-Sets</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162106#static:
You can equip Champions with <color=#ffe87d>more than one Artifact Set</color>. 

Effective combinations of Sets can make a huge difference in how strong a Champion is.

Artifact Set Bonuses <color=#ffe87d>stack</color>, meaning their effects are cumulative and add together. 

You can equip a Champion with up to 6 Artifacts. One Champion could have up to three 2-Sets, or one 2-Set and a 4-Set depending on how you want to build them.

Try equipping a Champion with <color=#ffe87d>three 2-Sets</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162107#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162201#static:
When you upgrade an Artifact to <color=#ffe87d>Level 8</color>, you'll unlock its <color=#ffe87d>second substat</color>, or improve a random substat if the Artifact already has 2 innate substats. 

Upgrade 3 Artifacts to level 8 and see what opportunities it gives you!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162202#static:
When you upgrade an Artifact to <color=#ffe87d>Level 8</color>, you'll unlock its <color=#ffe87d>second substat</color>, or improve a random substat if the Artifact already has 2 innate substats. 

Upgrade 6 Artifacts to level 8 and see what opportunities it gives you!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162203#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Support</color> type Champions help other Champions during battle.

Your Support Champions don't need to do much damage, but need to stay alive and help your team. Along with being fast to help them use their Skills often, they need to have enough HP.

Make sure that your Support Champion can keep contributing to the fight by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>3 HP Artifact Sets</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162204#static:
The more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> a Champion has, the longer they can stay in the fight.

Make one of your Champions legendarily tough by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>10,000 HP</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162205#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> type Champions are usually there to deal as much damage as possible.

Play to that Champion's strength and make them even deadlier by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>3 Offense Artifact Sets</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162206#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> is often the deciding stat in the outcome of any battle. 

Oftentimes the best defense is a good offence, killing your foes before they have a chance to fight back. 

Strengthen one of your Champions by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>800 ATK</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162207#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162301#static:
When you upgrade an Artifact to <color=#ffe87d>Level 16</color>, it will receive a huge boost to its <color=#ffe87d>primary stat</color> and will unlock or upgrade its final <color=#ffe87d>substat</color>.

Experience the awesome power for yourself and upgrade <color=#ffe87d>6 Artifacts to Level 16</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162302#static:
Artifacts come in the following <color=#ffe87d>Rarities</color>: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, and Legendary. 

Rarer Artifacts start with more <color=#ffe87d>innate substats</color>, meaning their potential strength is much higher when fully upgraded. 

Equip a Champion with an <color=#ffe87d>Artifact Set of Epic or higher Rarity</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162303#static:
Artifacts come in different <color=#ffe87d>Ranks</color>, from 1-Star (*) to 6-Star (******). 

The higher the Rank, the larger its primary stat and substats. 

Champions equipped with rarer and higher-ranked Artifacts are much stronger and more effective in battle.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162304#static:
HP Champions have more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> than other types.

The <color=#ffe87d>Regeneration Artifact Set</color> activates a <color=#ffe87d>Heal</color> at the start of the wearer's turn, equal to <color=#ffe87d>15% of that Champion's HP</color>. 

Equip an HP type Champion with a Regeneration Set to maximize the benefit from this passive <color=#ffe87d>Heal</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162305#static:
<color=#ffe87d>DEF</color> Champions - particularly those with <color=#ffe87d>[Provoke] Skills</color> - are usually built to take hits. 

Equip one with a <color=#ffe87d>Frost Artifact Set</color> to punish attackers when they hit your Champion. Frost Artifacts have a <color=#ffe87d>20% chance of placing a [Freeze] debuff</color> for 1 turn on opposing attackers.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162306#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> type Champions benefit from attacking hard and attacking often.

To increase their overall damage output, equip one with a <color=#ffe87d>Relentless Artifact Set</color>. 

These Sets give the wearer an <color=#ffe87d>18% chance of getting an Extra Turn</color>.

Raid-Tip: While Relentless Sets are good for attackers and farmers, they're also great for Support Champions - the more turns they take, the more they support your team!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162307#static:
The more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> a Champion has, the longer they can stay in the fight.

Make one of your Champions legendarily tough by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>50,000 HP</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162308#static:
<color=#ffe87d>C. RATE</color> shows the percentage chance for your Champion to land a critical hit. 

When a Champion lands a critical hit, the attack will do extra damage, known as critical damage (C. DMG).

A Champion's <color=#ffe87d>C. DMG</color> stat shows how much extra damage a critical hit does. 

Higher levels of both will increase a Champion's overall damage output. See just how much damage you can pump out with <color=#ffe87d>75% C. RATE</color> and <color=#ffe87d>150% C. DMG</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162309#static:
<color=#ffe87d>SPD</color> is one of the most important stats a Champion can have.

SPD dictates how quickly a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Turn Meter</color> fills, influencing how often they get to take a turn.

Most importantly, <color=#ffe87d>SPD decides who moves first</color> in battle - and in which order the rest of your Champions move. 

Going first, particularly in Arena battles, is often the deciding factor in who wins. You can weaken the enemy team or set up your own team to attack before the enemy has a chance.

Upgrade a Champion until they reach <color=#ffe87d>150 SPD</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=162310#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163101#static:
<color=#ffe87d>HP</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>, <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>SPD</color> are your Champions' main base stats. 

While a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>SPD</color> does not change through levelling up, <color=#ffe87d>HP</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> increase every time you level up a Champion. The higher a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rarity</color>, the higher these three stats start at. 

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163102#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade a Skill on a <color=#ffe87d>Rare</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Epic</color>, or <color=#ffe87d>Legendary</color> Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163103#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Champion</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163104#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Magic Champion</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163105#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Force Champion</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163106#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Ascension</color> increases a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>HP</color>, <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>. 

Ascension can also unlock an extra <color=#ffe87d>Skill</color> or even upgrade an existing Skill to an improved <color=#ffe87d>Ascended</color> version. 

You can Ascend a Champion a number of times equal to their <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color>. Each time you do, one of their Rank stars turns purple. 

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank to Ascend them further, until you reach the maximum of <color=#ffe87d>Rank 6</color> with <color=#ffe87d>6 Ascensions</color>. 

Ascension requires <color=#ffe87d>Lesser</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Greater</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Superior Potions</color> of the same <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> as your Champion, as well as <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color>, which are used for Ascending all Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163107#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163201#static:
Common Champions can be sacrificed to improve the Rank of rarer and more valuable Champions, but only if they themselves get their Rank improved to match the Rank of the superior Champion.

First, level them up to the maximum Level for Rank 1.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163202#static:
Once a Rank 1 Champion reaches Level 10, you can sacrifice another Rank 1 Champion to improve the max-Level Champion's Rank to Rank 2. 

This will reset their Level to 1, but raises their Level cap to 20 at Rank 2. They'll be exceeding their former power in no time.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163203#static:
Now that your Common Champions have been improved to Rank 2, they can level all the way up to Level 20. 

If you want to improve them further to Rank 3, you'll need them to hit that Level cap for Rank 2.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163204#static:
Not many Common Champions can boast as much power as yours! 

If Rank 2 Champions reach Level 20, they can be upgraded to Rank 3, the same as your starting Champion you picked long ago. 

Just remember that you must sacrifice a different Rank 2 Champion to do so.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163205#static:
Levelling a Champion up greatly increases their base stats, raising their strength and usefulness. 

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163206#static:
To take a Rank 3 Champion to Rank 4, that Champion will need to be max-Level and you'll need to sacrifice three Rank 3 Champions. 

Choose carefully who to improve and who to sacrifice, and bring a Rare Champion up to Rank 4.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163207#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163301#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Ascension</color> increases a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>HP</color>, <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>. 

Ascension can also unlock an extra <color=#ffe87d>Skill</color> or even upgrade an existing Skill to an improved <color=#ffe87d>Ascended</color> version. 

You can Ascend a Champion a number of times equal to their <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color>. Each time you do, one of their Rank stars turns purple. 

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank to Ascend them further, until you reach the maximum of <color=#ffe87d>Rank 6</color> with <color=#ffe87d>6 Ascensions</color>. 

Ascension requires <color=#ffe87d>Lesser</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Greater</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Superior Potions</color> of the same <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> as your Champion, as well as <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color>, which are used for Ascending all Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163302#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade a Skill on a <color=#ffe87d>Rare</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Epic</color>, or <color=#ffe87d>Legendary</color> Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163303#static:
Levelling a Champion up greatly increases their base stats, raising their strength and effectiveness. 

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163304#static:

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Champion</color>. Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163305#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Magic Champion</color>. Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163306#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Force Champion</color>. Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163307#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163401#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163402#static:
Levelling a Champion up greatly increases their base stats, raising their strength and usefulness. 

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163403#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Ascension</color> increases a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>HP</color>, <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>. 

Ascension can also unlock an extra <color=#ffe87d>Skill</color> or even upgrade an existing Skill to an improved <color=#ffe87d>Ascended</color> version. 

You can Ascend a Champion a number of times equal to their <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color>. Each time you do, one of their Rank stars turns purple. 

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank to Ascend them further, until you reach the maximum of <color=#ffe87d>Rank 6</color> with <color=#ffe87d>6 Ascensions</color>. 

Ascension requires <color=#ffe87d>Lesser</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Greater</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Superior Potions</color> of the same <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> as your Champion, as well as <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color>, which are used for Ascending all Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163404#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade at least one Skill on <color=#ffe87d>2 Champions</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163405#static:
You know what your Champions are capable of, but there are always greater powers in the realm. 

Epic Champions have higher <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> stats than Rare Champions, and stronger Skills - with more Buffs and Debuffs, and higher chances of placing them.

Summon an <color=#ffe87d>Epic Champion</color> and see for yourself.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163406#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163501#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163502#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163503#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163504#static: You're already familiar with Ascension. Now Ascend a Champion to <color=#ffe87d>Level 6</color> to unlock their full potential.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163505#static:
You've seen how Champion <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> matchups can help or hinder you. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Void Champion</color> to stay unaffected by Affinity differences.

They are <color=#ffe87d>neutral to other Affinities</color>, making them suitable for any fight. Their attacks deal consistent damage agains each Affinity, and their Debuffs always have a consistent chance of landing.

Summon one and see what they can do for you.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163506#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade a Skill on a <color=#ffe87d>Rare</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Epic</color>, or <color=#ffe87d>Legendary</color> Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163507#static:
Each Champion belongs to a certain <color=#ffe87d>Faction</color>. 

To save Teleria, unity will bring us strength. Collect a Champion from each <color=#ffe87d>Faction</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=163508#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164101#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Arena</color> battles are where you fight against <color=#ffe87d>other players</color>.

For each victory in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> you receive <color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> and <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color>. 

The number of <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color> you have determines which <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Tier</color> you are in - and your Tier determines the reward you receive at the end of the <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Period</color>. 

Tier placement also gives your Champions <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color> and <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> bonuses in all types of battles. 

<color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> can be used to upgrade Affinity Bonuses at the <color=#ffe87d>Great Hall</color> to give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164102#static:
Your <color=#ffe87d>Arena Defense</color> fights on your behalf when other players attack you.

This happens automatically every time you're attacked, so make sure to select your strongest Champions for your Defense. Set up a weak defense and you'll <color=#ffe87d>lose Arena Points</color>. 

Remember: You win Arena Points for each Defense win, but <color=#ffe87d>not</color> Medals - you have to attack other players in Classic Arena to win Medals.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164103#static:
Picking your battles is the key to success. 

Identify your target and choose a well-synergized team, and you might be able to cruise to victory in Arena battles. 

Prove your prowess by winning a Classic Arena battle <color=#ffe87d>without losing any Champions</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164104#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Bronze Medals</color> allow you to upgrade any <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> up to <color=#ffe87d>Level 3</color>. 

Earn <color=#ffe87d>20 Bronze Medals</color> by attacking other players in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164105#static:
The higher the <color=#ffe87d>Tier</color> you're in, the <color=#ffe87d>stronger your opponents will be</color>. 

Prove your battle skills by getting to Bronze III.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164106#static:
It's time to activate your first <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> at the Great Hall! 

<color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonuses</color> give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats. It takes a while to fully upgrade all the Bonuses, but the payoff is well worth it.

Upgrading a Bonus to its maximum Level requires <color=#ffe87d>Bronze</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Silver</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Gold Medals</color>.

Note: Bonuses for each <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> are upgraded <color=#ffe87d>separately</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164107#static: Wheres the fun in training mighty Champions if you cant show off their prowess?
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164201#static:
Arena veterans can take on any opponent.

Show that you can handle it by beating 5 players in a row in Arena offense in Classic Arena.

Choose your <color=#ffe87d>Champions</color> wisely and make sure your <color=#ffe87d>team composition</color> is suitable for each battle. Your Champions need to complement each others' skillsets and exploit your opponents' weaknesses.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164202#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Arena</color> battles are where you fight against <color=#ffe87d>other players</color>.

For each victory in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> you receive <color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> and <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color>. 

The number of <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color> you have determines which <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Tier</color> you are in - and your Tier determines the reward you receive at the end of the <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Period</color>. 

Tier placement also gives your Champions <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color> and <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> bonuses in all types of battles. 

<color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> can be used to upgrade Affinity Bonuses at the <color=#ffe87d>Great Hall</color> to give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164203#static:
Killing an enemy during the <color=#ffe87d>first turn</color>, before they can hurt or debuff your Champions, lets you preserve the <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> of your party for later fights. 

See if you can pull it off!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164204#static: Make your <color=#ffe87d>Champions</color> stronger by upgrading <color=#ffe87d>ATK Bonuses</color> for all Affinities <color=#ffe87d>except</color> Void.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164205#static:
The higher the <color=#ffe87d>Tier</color> you're in, the <color=#ffe87d>stronger your opponents will be</color>. 

Prove your battle skills by getting to Silver I.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164206#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Silver Medals</color> allow you to upgrade any <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> up to <color=#ffe87d>Level 6</color>. 

Earn <color=#ffe87d>30 Silver Medals</color> by attacking other players in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=164207#static: Wheres the fun in training mighty Champions if you cant show off their prowess?
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215101#static:
To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Magic Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Magic Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Magic Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215105#static:
Clearing Dungeons on <color=#ffe87d>Auto</color> saves time.

You will need <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Keep</color> to Ascend Champions of <color=#ffe87d>any Affinity</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Unlike other Potion Dungeons, the Arcane Keep is always open.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215150#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215201#static:
Every Boss has strengths and weaknesses. You'll have to come up with a strategy and build the right team to defeat each of them.

The Force Guardian has a passive that grants him extremely high <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>. Although some rarer Champions with Ignore DEF Skills can make this fight easier, the safest way to victory is simply by decreasing his DEF.

Choose a Champion who can place a <color=#ffe87d>[Decrease DEF] debuff</color> and defeat the <color=#ffe87d>Force Guardian</color>
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215202#static:
To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Magic Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Magic Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Magic Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215205#static:
Clearing Dungeons on <color=#ffe87d>Auto</color> saves time.

You will need <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Keep</color> to Ascend Champions of <color=#ffe87d>any Affinity</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Unlike other Potion Dungeons, the Arcane Keep is always open.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215206#static:
If you need a Greater Potion quickly, you can mix one using Lesser Potions.

Mix Potions in the Tavern to Ascend Champions without having to dive back into a Potion Dungeon. This is especially useful when you need to Ascend Champions on a day when their Affinity's Potion Dungeon is not open.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215207#static:
The Spider's Den is tough, but the rewards are worth it.

Beating the Spider's Den is the main way to earn Accessories for your Champions.

Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions. However, Accessories have a couple of key differences:
- Accessories don't have Sets or Set Bonuses.
- Each Accessory belongs to a certain Faction, and can only be equipped by Champions belonging to that Faction.

Clear the Spider's Den and win your Champions some Accessories.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215208#static:
The Boss of the Dragon's Lair, Hellrazor, has a Secret Skill, <color=#ffe87d>Scorch</color>.

When unlocked, Hellrazor will change stance in preparation to strike. Scorch will unleash a devastating AOE attack that places a <color=#ffe87d>[Stun] debuff</color> on all enemies for 1 turn. However, <color=#ffe87d>Scorch</color> can be locked and hidden again if Hellrazor takes enough damage while preparing to attack. 

Choose high-damage Champions and prevent Hellrazor from successfully launching his <color=#ffe87d>Scorch</color> attack.

Hint: If you're struggling to do enough damage, take Champions that can place <color=#ffe87d>[Decrease DEF]</color> or <color=#ffe87d>[Weaken] debuffs</color>, as well as <color=#ffe87d>[Increase ATK] buffs</color> to amplify the damage you deal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215250#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215301#static:
The Boss of the <color=#ffe87d>Magic Keep</color> protects herself with a powerful <color=#ffe87d>[Shield]</color>. 

Breaking the <color=#ffe87d>[Shield]</color> works, but it is slow and inefficient.

See if you can use one of your Champions' Skills to <color=#ffe87d>remove the [Shield] buff directly</color>. 

Or better yet, <color=#ffe87d>steal it for yourself!</color>
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215302#static:
The Boss of the <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Keep</color> has the ability to heal herself, prolonging the battle and giving her more chances to kill off your Champions. 

Find a Champion with a Skill that places a <color=#ffe87d>[Heal Reduction] debuff</color> on her to shut her healing down.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215303#static:
Clearing Dungeons on <color=#ffe87d>Auto</color> saves time.

To <color=#ffe87d>Ascend</color> Force Champions, you'll need <color=#ffe87d>Force Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Force Keep</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!

Remember, most Potion Dungeons are only open on certain days of the week, so don't miss out!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215305#static:
The Boss of the <color=#ffe87d>Void Keep</color> places dangerous <color=#ffe87d>Debuffs</color> on your Champions. 

Choose Champions with Skills that have remove Debuffs, or even use a <color=#ffe87d>[Block Debuffs] buff</color> to prevent the Debuffs in the first place.

Learning to counter the Boss' mechanics gives you a fighting chance of success.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215306#static:
Clearing Dungeons on <color=#ffe87d>Auto</color> saves time.

You will need <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color> from the <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Keep</color> to Ascend Champions of <color=#ffe87d>any Affinity</color>. 

Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills.

Unlike other Potion Dungeons, the Arcane Keep is always open.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215307#static:
If you need a Superior Potion quickly, you can mix one using Greater Potions.

Mix Potions in the Tavern to Ascend Champions without having to dive back into a Potion Dungeon. This is especially useful when you need to Ascend Champions on a day when their Affinity's Potion Dungeon is not open.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215308#static:
Clearing Dungeons on <color=#ffe87d>Auto</color> saves time.

The Ice Golem's Peak holds some of the most flexible Artifact Sets around. It's not the most difficult Dungeon, but helps set your Champions up for taking on Teleria's toughest challenges.

Beat this Dungeon on Auto and win some powerful Artifacts for your Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215350#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215405#static:
The <color=#ffe87d>Dragon's Lair</color> is a challenging <color=#ffe87d>Dungeon</color> but it offers rich rewards, including <color=#ffe87d>unique Artifacts</color> found nowhere else. 

Challenge the mighty dragon Hellrazor for glory, honor, and loot!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215406#static:
The Fire Knight's Castle contains some of the rarest and most powerful Artifacts in all of Teleria.

If you want to test your Champions against the absolute best, you'll need to get your hands on some Artifacts from this Dungeon.

But it doesn't come easy. Fyro is one of the toughest bosses around.

Study the boss' skillset and build a team to take down Fyro and clear the Dungeon.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=215550#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220101#static:
The primary stat of some Artifacts can vary, but certain Artifacts will always have the same primary stat.

Weapons always have ATK as their primary stat - meaning every Champion equipped with a Weapon will have an increase to their ATK.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220102#static:
The primary stat of some Artifacts can vary, but certain Artifacts will always have the same primary stat.

Helmets always have HP as their primary stat - meaning every Champion equipped with a Helmet will have an increase to their HP.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220103#static:
The primary stat of some Artifacts can vary, but certain Artifacts will always have the same primary stat.

Shields always have DEF as their primary stat - meaning every Champion equipped with a Shield will have an increase to their DEF.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220104#static:
The primary stat of some Artifacts can vary, but certain Artifacts will always have the same primary stat.

Gauntlets can have different primary stats, but for a Life Set, the most beneficial stat is often HP or DEF. 

Like with all Artifact Sets, keep raiding until you find Artifacts with primary stats that synergize well with both the Champion and the Set itself.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220105#static:
The primary stat of some Artifacts can vary, but certain Artifacts will always have the same primary stat.

Chestplates can have different primary stats, but for a Life Set, the most beneficial stat is often HP or DEF. 

Like with all Artifact Sets, keep raiding until you find Artifacts with primary stats that synergize well with both the Champion and the Set itself.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220106#static:
The primary stat of some Artifacts can vary, but certain Artifacts will always have the same primary stat.

Boots can have different primary stats, but for a Life Set, the most beneficial stat is often HP or DEF. 

Like with all Artifact Sets, keep raiding until you find Artifacts with primary stats that synergize well with both the Champion and the Set itself.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220107#static:
The final stage in each Campaign location can drop any Artifact: Shield, Helmet, Weapon, Chestplate, Gauntlets or Boots. This makes them good places to hunt for Artifacts for different types of Champions.

Like with all Artifact Sets, keep raiding until you find Artifacts with primary stats that synergize well with both the Champion and the Set itself.

Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220108#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Support</color> type Champions help other Champions during battle.

Your Support Champions don't need to do much damage, but need to stay alive and help your team. Along with being fast to help them use their Skills often, they need to have enough HP.

Make sure that your Support Champion can keep contributing to the fight by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>1 HP Artifact Set</color> to get a 15% HP increase.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220109#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Support</color> type Champions help other Champions during battle.

Your Support Champions don't need to do much damage, but need to stay alive and help your team. Along with being fast to help them use their Skills often, they need to have enough HP.

Make sure that your Support Champion can keep contributing to the fight by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>2 HP Artifact Sets</color> to get a 30% HP increase.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220110#static:

Make sure that your Support Champion can keep contributing to the fight by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>3 HP Artifact Sets</color> to get a 45% HP increase.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220150#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.

Gauntlets can have different primary stats, but for an Offense Set, the most beneficial stat is often ATK or C. DMG. 

Like with all Artifact Sets, keep raiding until you find Artifacts with primary stats that synergize well with both the Champion and the Set itself.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220208#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> type Champions are usually there to deal as much damage as possible.

Play to that Champion's strength and make them even deadlier by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>1 Offense Artifact Set</color> to get a 15% ATK increase.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220250#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220301#static:
Upgrading an <color=#ffe87d>Artifact</color> improves its <color=#ffe87d>primary stat</color> bonus. Further upgrades unlock and improve <color=#ffe87d>substats</color> at key milestone levels.

Rarer Artifacts have more <color=#ffe87d>innate substats</color>, meaning their potential strength is much higher when fully upgraded.

Upgrade any Artifact to Level 4 to unlock a new substat or improve an existing one.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220302#static:
Now that you've seen the true potential of <color=#ffe87d>Artifacts</color>, use your <color=#ffe87d>Silver</color> wisely and upgrade some of your strongest Artifacts. 

Hitting <color=#ffe87d>Level 4</color> is particularly important, because <color=#ffe87d>Level 4</color> is when the first <color=#ffe87d>substat</color> is unlocked (or improved, if the Artifact has at least 1 innate substat).

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220401#static:
Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. 

For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts, while Hard and Brutal drop Artifacts of higher Rank and Rarity.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220407#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> type Champions are usually there to deal as much damage as possible.

Play to that Champion's strength and make them even deadlier by equipping one with <color=#ffe87d>three Offense Artifact Sets</color> of <color=#ffe87d>3* or higher</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220450#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220501#static:
When you upgrade an Artifact to <color=#ffe87d>Level 8</color>, you'll unlock its <color=#ffe87d>second substat</color>, or improve a random substat if the Artifact already has 2 innate substats. 

Upgrade 3 Artifacts to level 8 and see what opportunities it gives you!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220502#static:
When you upgrade an Artifact to <color=#ffe87d>Level 8</color>, you'll unlock its <color=#ffe87d>second substat</color>, or improve a random substat if the Artifact already has 2 innate substats. 

Upgrade 6 Artifacts to level 8 and see what opportunities it gives you!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220503#static:
When you upgrade an Artifact to <color=#ffe87d>Level 8</color>, you'll unlock its <color=#ffe87d>second substat</color>, or improve a random substat if the Artifact already has 2 innate substats. 

Upgrade 12 Artifacts to level 8 and see what opportunities it gives you!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220504#static:
The more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> a Champion has, the longer they can stay in the fight.

Make one of your Champions legendarily tough by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>10,000 HP</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220505#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> is often the deciding stat in the outcome of any battle. 

Often the best defense is a good offense - killing your foes before they have a chance to fight shuts down their chances of winning. 

Strengthen one of your Champions by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>800 ATK</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220506#static:
Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions. 

However, Accessories have a couple of key differences:
- Accessories don't have Sets or Set Bonuses.
- Each Accessory belongs to a certain Faction, and can only be equipped by Champions belonging to that Faction.

Try equipping any of your Champions with an Accessory.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220550#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220601#static:
Gauntlets can have the following primary stats: C. RATE (%), C. DMG (%), HP (+ or %), ATK (+ or %), DEF (+ or %).

Win 2* or higher Gauntlets with ATK (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 4 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220602#static:
Chestplates can have the following primary stats: ACC (+), RES (+), HP (+ or %), ATK (+ or %), DEF (+ or %).

Win a 2* or higher Chestplate with ATK (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 5 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220603#static:
Boots can have the following primary stats: SPD (+), HP (+ or %), ATK (+ or %), DEF (+ or %).

Win 2* or higher Boots with ATK (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 6 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220604#static:
ATK type Champions usually benefit the most from increasing their ATK as much as possible.

Try equipping an ATK type Champion with 2* or higher Gauntlets, Boots, and a Chestplate with ATK (%) as the primary stats, and see how much stronger they become.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220605#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> is often the deciding stat in the outcome of any battle. 

Often the best defense is a good offense - killing your foes before they have a chance to fight back shuts down their chances of winning. 

Strengthen one of your Champions by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>999.5 ATK</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220606#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 2 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 3* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220607#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 3 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 3* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220608#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 4 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 3* or higher, and upgrading each of the Artifacts to at least Level 8.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220650#static: No matter their personal power, no Champion can last long without top-notch equipment.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220701#static:
Beating the Campaign on Normal unlocks higher difficulties, giving you the opportunity to win more Rewards and even stronger Artifacts.

Prove your Champions are ready for tougher tests by beating the Campaign on Normal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220702#static:
Clearing Campaign locations on the different difficulty options changes the potential Artifact drops. 

For example, clearing stages on Normal drops 1*, 2*, and 3* Artifacts, while Hard and Brutal drop Artifacts of higher Rank and Rarity.

Beat Campaign levels on Hard or higher and win a 4* Artifact.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220703#static:
Gauntlets can have the following primary stats: C. RATE (%), C. DMG (%), HP (+ or %), ATK (+ or %), DEF (+ or %). 

Win 4* or higher Gauntlets with HP (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 4 of Kaerok Castle  on Hard or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220704#static:
Chestplates can have the following primary stats: ACC (+), RES (+), HP (+ or %), ATK (+ or %), DEF (+ or %). 

Win a 4* or higher Chestplate with HP (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 5 of Kaerok Castle  on Hard or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220705#static:
Boots can have the following primary stats: SPD (+), HP (+ or %), ATK (+ or %), DEF (+ or %).

Win 4* or higher Boots with HP (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 6 of Kaerok Castle  on Hard or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220706#static:
Support type Champions need to stay alive as long as possible to support your team. Stacking HP is the easiest way to add some staying-power to your Support Champions.

Try equipping a Support type Champion with 4* or higher Gauntlets, Boots, and a Chestplate with HP (%) as the primary stats, and see how much more effective they are.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220707#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Get a Champion ready for battle by equipping them with three Artifact Sets of 4* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220708#static:
The more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> a Champion has, the longer they can stay in the fight. 

Make one of your Champions legendarily tough by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>30,000 HP</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220750#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.

Win 4* or higher Boots with ATK (%) as the primary stat from clearing Campaign locations on Hard or higher.

Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 2 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 4* or higher.
