Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 3 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 4* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220807#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 4 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 4* or higher, and upgrading each of the Artifacts to at least Level 12.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220850#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220901#static:
Beating the Campaign on Hard unlocks Brutal difficulty, where you can win even bigger Rewards and even stronger Artifacts.

Prove your Champions are ready to take on Brutal difficulty by beating the Campaign on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220902#static:
Beating Campaign locations on Brutal gives you the chance to win 5* Artifacts and help set your Champions up to take on Teleria's Dungeons.

Win a 5* Artifact from clearing Stage 1 of Kaerok Castle on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220903#static:
Beating Campaign locations on Brutal gives you the chance to win 5* Artifacts and help set your Champions up to take on Teleria's Dungeons.

Win a 5* Artifact from clearing Stage 2 of Kaerok Castle on Brutal
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220904#static:
Beating Campaign locations on Brutal gives you the chance to win 5* Artifacts and help set your Champions up to take on Teleria's Dungeons.

Win a 5* Artifact from clearing Stage 3 of Kaerok Castle on Brutal
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220905#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Get a Champion ready for battle by equipping them with three Artifact Sets of 5* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220906#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 2 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 5* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220907#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 3 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 5* or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220908#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Ready 4 Champions for battle by equipping each of them with three Artifact Sets of 5* or higher, and upgrading each of the Artifacts to at least Level 12.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220909#static:
Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions. 

However, Accessories have a couple of key differences:
- Accessories don't have Sets or Set Bonuses.
- Each Accessory belongs to a certain Faction, and can only be equipped by Champions belonging to that Faction.

To unlock all the Accessory Slots, a Champion must be Rank 6 and fully Ascended.

Transform a Champion into a legend by equipping them with 3 Accessories.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=220950#static: Master the Dungeons, and your Champions will flourish like never before.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221001#static:
Beating the Campaign on Brutal gives you the chance to win powerful Artifacts, Shards, Silver, and even Champions.

Take the challenge and beat the Campaign on Brutal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221002#static:
Artifact Rank has a significant impact on the overall strength of the Artifact  and therefore the strength of the wearer.

Artifact Rarity increases those effects even further. The higher the Rarity of an Artifact, the more substats it starts with.

Try equipping a Champion with a 5* or 6* Epic or Legendary Artifact Set.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221003#static:
HP Champions have more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> than other types.

The <color=#ffe87d>Regeneration Artifact Set</color> activates a <color=#ffe87d>Heal</color> at the start of the wearer's turn, equal to <color=#ffe87d>15% of that Champion's HP</color>. 

Equip an HP type Champion with a Regeneration Set to maximize the benefit from this passive <color=#ffe87d>Heal</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221004#static:
<color=#ffe87d>DEF</color> Champions - particularly those with <color=#ffe87d>[Provoke] Skills</color> - are usually built to take hits. 

Equip one with a <color=#ffe87d>Frost Artifact Set</color> to punish attackers when they hit your Champion. Frost Artifacts have a <color=#ffe87d>20% chance of placing a [Freeze] debuff</color> for 1 turn on opposing attackers.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221005#static:
<color=#ffe87d>ATK</color> type Champions benefit from attacking hard and attacking often. To increase their overall damage output, equip one with a <color=#ffe87d>Retaliation Artifact Set</color>. These Sets give the wearer a <color=#ffe87d>35% chance to Counterattack when hit</color>.

Raid-Tip: Retaliation Sets can be used with some tankier damage dealers, but they are not a good Set for glass cannons or other easy-to-kill attackers, as the wearer benefits from being able to take a hit from the enemy.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221006#static:
<color=#ffe87d>SPD</color> is one of the most important stats a Champion can have.

SPD dictates how quickly a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Turn Meter</color> fills, influencing how often they get to take a turn.

Most importantly, <color=#ffe87d>SPD decides who moves first</color> in battle - and in which order the rest of your Champions move. 

Going first, particularly in Arena battles, is often the deciding factor in who wins. You can weaken the enemy team or set up your own team to attack before the enemy has a chance.

Upgrade a Champion until they reach <color=#ffe87d>150 SPD</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221007#static:
The more <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> a Champion has, the longer they can stay in the fight. 

Make one of your Champions legendarily tough by upgrading them until they reach <color=#ffe87d>50,000 HP</color> through their base stats and Artifacts alone.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=221008#static:
<color=#ffe87d>C. RATE</color> shows the percentage chance for your Champion to land a critical hit. 

When a Champion lands a critical hit, the attack will do extra damage, known as critical damage (C. DMG).

A Champion's <color=#ffe87d>C. DMG</color> stat shows how much extra damage a critical hit does. 

Higher levels of both will increase a Champion's overall damage output. See just how much damage you can pump out with <color=#ffe87d>75% C. RATE</color> and <color=#ffe87d>150% C. DMG</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225101#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Champion</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225102#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Magic Champion</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225103#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Force Champion</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225104#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade a Skill on a <color=#ffe87d>Rare</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Epic</color>, or <color=#ffe87d>Legendary</color> Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225105#static:
The more you upgrade your Champions, the better your chances of winning. 

Upgrade 4 Champions to Level 20 or higher and beat a Campaign location.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225150#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225201#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon <color=#ffe87d>6 Common Champions</color>. 

Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225202#static:
Common Champions can be sacrificed to improve the Rank of rarer and more valuable Champions, but only if they themselves get their Rank improved to match the Rank of the superior Champion.

First, level them up to the maximum Level for Rank 1.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225203#static:
Once a Rank 1 Champion reaches Level 10, you can sacrifice another Rank 1 Champion to improve the max-Level Champion's Rank to Rank 2. 

This will reset their Level to 1, but raises their Level cap to 20 at Rank 2. They'll be exceeding their former power in no time.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225204#static:
Now that your Common Champions have been improved to Rank 2, they can level all the way up to Level 20. 

If you want to improve them further to Rank 3, you'll need them to hit that Level cap for Rank 2.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225205#static:
Not many Common Champions can boast as much power as yours! 

If Rank 2 Champions reach Level 20, they can be upgraded to Rank 3, the same as your starting Champion you picked long ago. 

Just remember that you must sacrifice a different Rank 2 Champion to do so.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225206#static:
Levelling a Champion up greatly increases their base stats, raising their strength and usefulness. 

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225207#static:
To take a Rank 3 Champion to Rank 4, that Champion will need to be max-Level and you'll need to sacrifice three Rank 3 Champions. 

Choose carefully who to improve and who to sacrifice, and bring a Rare Champion up to Rank 4.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225208#static:
The more you upgrade your Champions, the better your chances of winning. 

Upgrade 4 Champions to Level 30 or higher and beat a Campaign location.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225209#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Ascension</color> increases a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>HP</color>, <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color>. 

Ascension can also unlock an extra <color=#ffe87d>Skill</color> or even upgrade an existing Skill to an improved <color=#ffe87d>Ascended</color> version. 

You can Ascend a Champion a number of times equal to their <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color>. Each time you do, one of their Rank stars turns purple. 

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank to Ascend them further, until you reach the maximum of <color=#ffe87d>Rank 6</color> with <color=#ffe87d>6 Ascensions</color>. 

Ascension requires <color=#ffe87d>Lesser</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Greater</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Superior Potions</color> of the same <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> as your Champion, as well as <color=#ffe87d>Arcane Potions</color>, which are used for Ascending all Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225250#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225301#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Spirit Champion</color>. Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225302#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Summoning</color> is the most common way to get new Champions. 

Summon a <color=#ffe87d>Magic Champion</color>. Remember that <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Spirit</color> but <color=#ffe87d>Force</color> beats <color=#ffe87d>Magic</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225303#static:

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225306#static:

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225307#static:
The more you upgrade your Champions, the better your chances of winning. 

Upgrade 4 Champions to Level 40 or higher and beat a Campaign location.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225350#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225401#static:
To take a Rank 3 Champion to Rank 4, that Champion will need to be max-Level and you'll need to sacrifice three Rank 3 Champions.

Choose carefully who to improve and who to sacrifice, and bring 4 Champions up to Rank 4.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225402#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225403#static:
Levelling a Champion up greatly increases their base stats, raising their strength and usefulness. 

Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit.

You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern. When sacrificing, the amount of <color=#ffe87d>XP</color> the recipient Champion gets depends on the Level and Rank of the Champions you sacrifice.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225405#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade a Skill on a <color=#ffe87d>Rare</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Epic</color>, or <color=#ffe87d>Legendary</color> Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225406#static:
The more you upgrade your Champions, the better your chances of winning. 

Upgrade 4 Champions to Level 50 or higher and beat a Campaign location.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225450#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225501#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225502#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225503#static:
Upgrading a Champion's <color=#ffe87d>Rank</color> increases their maximum <color=#ffe87d>Level</color> by <color=#ffe87d>10</color>. To upgrade their Rank, Champions must be at the <color=#ffe87d>maximum Level</color> allowed by their current Rank. This is known as the <color=#ffe87d>Level cap</color>.

You can upgrade a Champion's Rank in the Tavern. After a Rank Upgrade, a Champion's Level resets to 1, but their stats will greatly increase as they level up again.

To upgrade a Champion's Rank, you must <color=#ffe87d>sacrifice Champions</color> of the <color=#ffe87d>same Rank</color> as the one you want to improve. To upgrade a Champion to Rank 2 you need <color=#ffe87d>one Rank 1</color> Champion. For Rank 3, you need <color=#ffe87d>two Rank 2</color> Champions. This pattern continues until the maximum Rank of 6 which needs <color=#ffe87d>five Rank 5</color> Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225504#static: You're already familiar with Ascension. Now Ascend a Champion to <color=#ffe87d>Level 6</color> to unlock their full potential.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225505#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Skill Upgrades</color> can improve various Skill properties, such as <color=#ffe87d>Cooldown</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Buff/Debuff Chance</color>, the <color=#ffe87d>Damage</color>, and more. 

Upgrade a Skill on a <color=#ffe87d>Rare</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Epic</color>, or <color=#ffe87d>Legendary</color> Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225506#static:
Each Champion belongs to a certain <color=#ffe87d>Faction</color>. 

To save Teleria, unity will bring us strength. Collect a Champion from each <color=#ffe87d>Faction</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225507#static:
The more you upgrade your Champions, the better your chances of winning. 

Upgrade 4 Champions to Level 60 and beat a Campaign location.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=225550#static: Your Champions must grow stronger to have any hope of defeating the Shadow that stalks Teleria.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230101#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Arena</color> battles are where you fight against <color=#ffe87d>other players</color>.

For each victory in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> you receive <color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> and <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color>. 

The number of <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color> you have determines which <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Tier</color> you are in - and your Tier determines the reward you receive at the end of the <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Period</color>. 

Tier placement also gives your Champions <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color> and <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> bonuses in all types of battles. 

<color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> can be used to upgrade Affinity Bonuses at the <color=#ffe87d>Great Hall</color> to give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230102#static:
Your <color=#ffe87d>Arena Defense</color> fights on your behalf when other players attack you.

This happens automatically every time you're attacked, so make sure to select your strongest Champions for your Defense. Set up a weak defense and you'll <color=#ffe87d>lose Arena Points</color>. 

Remember: You win Arena Points for each Defense win, but <color=#ffe87d>not</color> Medals - you have to attack other players in Classic Arena to win Medals.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230103#static:
Picking your battles is the key to success. 

Identify your target and choose a well-synergized team, and you might be able to cruise to victory in Arena battles. 

Prove your prowess by winning a Classic Arena battle <color=#ffe87d>without losing any Champions</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230104#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Bronze Medals</color> allow you to upgrade any <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> up to <color=#ffe87d>Level 3</color>. 

Earn <color=#ffe87d>20 Bronze Medals</color> by attacking other players in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230105#static:
The higher the <color=#ffe87d>Tier</color> you're in, the <color=#ffe87d>stronger your opponents will be</color>. 

Prove your battle skills by getting to Bronze III.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230106#static:
Your <color=#ffe87d>Arena Defense</color> fights on your behalf when other players attack you.

This happens automatically every time you're attacked, so make sure to select your strongest Champions for your Defense. Set up a weak defense and you'll <color=#ffe87d>lose Arena Points</color>. 

You can review the Arena Battle Log at any time to see how your Arena Defense is performing and adjust your strategy.

Set 4 Champions of Rank 3 or higher in your <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Defense</color> and see how they do.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230107#static:
It's time to activate your first <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> at the Great Hall! 

<color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonuses</color> give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats. It takes a while to fully upgrade all the Bonuses, but the payoff is well worth it.

Upgrading a Bonus to its maximum Level requires <color=#ffe87d>Bronze</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Silver</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Gold Medals</color>.

Note: Bonuses for each <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> are upgraded <color=#ffe87d>separately</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230150#static: Where's the fun in training mighty Champions if you can't show off their prowess?
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230201#static:
Arena veterans can take on any opponent.

Show that you can handle it by beating 5 players in a row in Arena offense in Classic Arena.

Choose your <color=#ffe87d>Champions</color> wisely and make sure your <color=#ffe87d>team composition</color> is suitable for each battle. Your Champions need to complement each others' skillsets and exploit your opponents' weaknesses.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230202#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Arena</color> battles are where you fight against <color=#ffe87d>other players</color>.

For each victory in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> you receive <color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> and <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color>. 

The number of <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color> you have determines which <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Tier</color> you are in - and your Tier determines the reward you receive at the end of the <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Period</color>. 

Tier placement also gives your Champions <color=#ffe87d>ATK</color>, <color=#ffe87d>DEF</color> and <color=#ffe87d>HP</color> bonuses in all types of battles. 

<color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> can be used to upgrade Affinity Bonuses at the <color=#ffe87d>Great Hall</color> to give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230203#static:
Killing an enemy during your <color=#ffe87d>first turn</color>, before they can hurt or debuff your Champions, lets you immediately skew the battle in your favor. Four versus three is much easier than four versus four. 

See if you can pull it off!
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230204#static: Make your <color=#ffe87d>Champions</color> stronger by upgrading <color=#ffe87d>ATK Bonuses</color> for all Affinities <color=#ffe87d>except</color> Void.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230205#static:
The higher the <color=#ffe87d>Tier</color> you're in, the <color=#ffe87d>stronger your opponents will be</color>. 

Prove your battle skills by getting to Silver I.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230206#static:
Your <color=#ffe87d>Arena Defense</color> fights on your behalf when other players attack you.

This happens automatically every time you're attacked, so make sure to select your strongest Champions for your Defense. Set up a weak defense and you'll <color=#ffe87d>lose Arena Points</color>. 

You can review the Arena Battle Log at any time to see how your Arena Defense is performing and adjust your strategy.

Set 4 Champions of Rank 3 or higher in your <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Defense</color> and see how they do.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230207#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Silver Medals</color> allow you to upgrade any <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> up to <color=#ffe87d>Level 6</color>. 

Earn <color=#ffe87d>30 Silver Medals</color> by attacking other players in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230250#static: Where's the fun in training mighty Champions if you can't show off their prowess?
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230301#static:
The higher the <color=#ffe87d>Tier</color> you're in, the <color=#ffe87d>stronger your opponents will be</color>.

Prove your battle skills by getting to Gold I.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230302#static:
Arena veterans can take on any opponent.

Beat 10 players in a row in Gold I or higher in Classic Arena.

Choose your <color=#ffe87d>Champions</color> wisely and make sure your <color=#ffe87d>team composition</color> is suitable for each battle. Your Champions need to complement each others' skillsets and exploit your opponents' weaknesses.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230303#static:
Your <color=#ffe87d>Arena Defense</color> fights on your behalf when other players attack you. 

This happens automatically every time you're attacked, so make sure to select your strongest Champions for your Defense. Set up a weak defense and you'll <color=#ffe87d>lose Arena Points</color>. 

Remember: You win Arena Points for each Defense win, but <color=#ffe87d>not</color> Medals - you have to attack other players in Classic Arena to win Medals.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230304#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Gold Medals</color> allow you to upgrade any <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonus</color> up to <color=#ffe87d>Level 10</color>.

Earn <color=#ffe87d>50 Gold Medals</color> by attacking other players in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230305#static:
One <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Period</color> in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> lasts a week and ends every Monday at 08:00 UTC. Your Classic Arena Tier determines the reward you receive at the end of the <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Period</color>.

Stay in the Gold Tier in Classic Arena for 2 <color=#ffe87d>Ranking Periods</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230306#static:
Upgrade 3 <color=#ffe87d>Affinity Bonuses</color> to Level 5.

Bonuses at the <color=#ffe87d>Great Hall</color> give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats. It takes a while to fully upgrade all the Bonuses, but the payoff is well worth it.

Upgrading a Bonus to its maximum Level requires <color=#ffe87d>Bronze</color>, <color=#ffe87d>Silver</color>, and <color=#ffe87d>Gold Medals</color>.

Note: Bonuses for each <color=#ffe87d>Affinity</color> are upgraded <color=#ffe87d>separately</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230307#static:
Your <color=#ffe87d>Arena Defense</color> fights on your behalf when other players attack you.

This happens automatically every time you're attacked, so make sure to select your strongest Champions for your Defense. Set up a weak defense and you'll <color=#ffe87d>lose Arena Points</color>. 

You can review the Arena Battle Log at any time to see how your Arena Defense is performing and adjust your strategy.

Set 4 Champions of Rank 4 or higher in your <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Defense</color> and see how they do.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=230350#static: Where's the fun in training mighty Champions if you can't show off their prowess?
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310001#static:
Clear Stage 7 of Kaerok Castle to unlock the second location in the Campaign. When you beat all the Stages at a Campaign location, youll unlock the next one - with each location more difficult than the last.

Clear Stage 7 of Kaerok Castle on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310002#static:
Artifacts are the primary way of strengthening your Champions, from boosting their base stats, to providing unique bonuses and skill effects.

Equip a Rare ATK type Champion with 6 Offense Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310003#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or adding new substats along the way. 

Upgrade 6 Offense Artifacts equipped on a Rare ATK type Champion to Level 4 or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310004#static:
Your adventure continues. Beat the second Campaign location and ready your Champions for tougher battles to come.

Clear Stage 7 of Sewers of Arnoc on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310005#static:
Artifacts are the primary way of strengthening your Champions, from boosting their base stats, to providing unique bonuses and skill effects.

Equip a Rare Support type Champion with 6 Life Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310006#static:
There's always room for improvement.

Upgrade 6 Life Artifacts equipped on a Rare Support type Champion to Level 4 or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310007#static:
Giving your Champions XP Brews gives them a large amount of XP in an instant, letting you level them up quickly and increase their power. XP Brews can be used on Champions of any Affinity, but if the Champion's Affinity matches the Affinity of the Brew, they'll receive a huge amount of bonus XP. 

Use 4 XP Brews at the Tavern.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310008#static:
The easiest way to get Champions is to summon them from Shards.

Summon 5 Champions at the Portal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310009#static:
The Arcane Keep contains Arcane Potions, which are used to Ascend Champions. Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Beat the Boss of the Arcane Keep on Stage 1.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310010#static:
Your legend has only just begun. Take your Champions one step further and unlock the fourth Campaign location.

Clear Stage 7 of Catacombs of Narbuk on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310011#static:
Upgrading Skills is the key to maximizing a Champion's effectiveness. Skill Tomes are incredibly powerful items that allow you to upgrade a Champion's Skills without needing duplicates of that Champion. Skill Tomes are rare, so use them wisely - don't use Epic or Legendary Tomes on Rare Champions.

Use a Skill Tome at the Tavern to upgrade a Skill of a Rare ATK type Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310012#static:
<color=#ffe87d>Arena</color> battles are where you put your team to the test against <color=#ffe87d>other players</color>.

For each victory in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> you receive <color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> and <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena Points</color>. 

<color=#ffe87d>Medals</color> can be used to upgrade Affinity Bonuses at the <color=#ffe87d>Great Hall</color> to give your Champions huge global boosts to their stats.

Fight in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> 3 times.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310013#static:
Masteries are special passive abilities that each Champion can unlock to enhance their performance. Masteries fall under one of three branches - Attack, Defense, or Support - to help Champions specialize for their role. To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth.

Unlock a Mastery for a Rare ATK type Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310014#static:
To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth. Mastery Scrolls are different to all other items in Raid in that a Champion has to earn them for themselves by participating in battles. Every time you beat a stage in the Labyrinth, one of the Champions on your team will receive Scrolls.

Clear Stage 1 of Minotaur's Labyrinth 2 times.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310015#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on every Stage of Kaerok Castle on Normal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310016#static:
The stronger your Artifacts, the stronger your Champions.

Win one of each type of Life Artifact - Weapon, Shield, Helmet, Chestplate, Gauntlets, and Boots - from clearing Kaerok Castle Stages on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310017#static:
You won't last long without enough HP to take a few hits.

Let one of your Champions show their true strength by equipping them with 6 Life Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310018#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or adding new substats along the way. 

Equip a Rare ATK type Champion with 6 Offense Artifacts of Level 8 or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310019#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on every Stage of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310020#static:
The stronger your Artifacts, the stronger your Champions.

Win one of each type of Offense Artifact - Weapon, Shield, Helmet, Chestplate, Gauntlets, and Boots - from clearing the Sewers of Arnoc Stages on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310021#static:
Most ATK Champions have skills that do more damage based on their ATK stat - and the quickest way to boost that stat is with Offense Artifacts.

Equip an ATK type Champion with 6 Offense Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310022#static:
Durham Forest is when things start getting tough. It's time to put your Champions to the test.

Beat Stage 4 of Durham Forest on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310023#static:
The stronger your Artifacts, the stronger your Champions.

Win 4 different types of Critical Rate Artifacts - such as Weapon, Shield, Helmet, Chestplate, Gauntlets, and Boots - from clearing Durham Forest Stages on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310024#static:
To Ascend a Champion, you'll need Potions. All Champions require a combination of Potions to Ascend: a number of Potions matched to the Champion's Affinity, plus a number of Affinity-neutral ones - Arcane Potions. To get Potions for a Champion's specific Affinity, you'll need to raid the relevant Potion Keep.

Win a total of 3 Lesser Potions from Spirit, Force, Magic, or Void Potion Dungeons.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310025#static:
Now it's time to close out Durham Forest and move onto the fifth location in the Campaign.

Clear Stage 7 of of Durham Forest on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310026#static:
All Artifacts have a primary stat that greatly increase Champions' stats when equipped. Some Artifacts, like Gauntlets, can have different primary stats - so you may have to hunt a little longer to find the right ones for a Champion's role.

Win Gauntlets with ATK (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 4 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310027#static:
You're doing well so far, but now it's time to step things up and take on the Ice Golem for some more powerful Artifacts. The Ice Golem's Peak holds some of the most flexible Artifact Sets around.

Clear Stage 1 of the Ice Golem's Peak 3 times (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310028#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or unlocking new substats along the way. 

Equip 4 Champions with 6 Artifacts of Level 8 or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310029#static:
Arena battles are all about carnage.

Test your teams against other players and <color=#ffe87d>defeat 20 Champions</color> in Arena Offense battles in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310030#static:
Levelling a Champion up greatly increases their base stats, raising their strength and usefulness. Champions can earn XP through Campaign, Dungeon, and Arena battles, and passively over time in the Sparring Pit. You can also upgrade a Champion's Level by sacrificing other Champions at the Tavern.

Level up your Rare ATK type Champion to Level 30.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310031#static:
There's always room for improvement.

Upgrade 2 Artifacts to Level 12 or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310032#static:
Continue your adventure.

Clear Stage 4 of Felwin's Gate on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310033#static:
All Artifacts have a primary stat that greatly increase Champions' stats when equipped. Some Artifacts, like Chestplates, can have different primary stats - so you may have to hunt a little longer to find the right ones for a Champion's role.

Win a Chestplate with ATK (%) as the primary stat from clearing Stage 5 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310034#static:
It's time to test your Champions against the might of the Dragon. The Dragon's Lair is a challenging Dungeon, but it offers rich rewards - including unique Artifacts found nowhere else.

Clear Stage 1 of the Dragon's Lair 3 times (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310035#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle.

Earn 60 Stars in the Campaign on Normal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310036#static:
You've come so far, but there's still a long way to go...

Clear Stage 7 of Felwin's Gate on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310037#static:
All Artifacts have a primary stat that greatly increase Champions' stats when equipped. Some Artifacts, like Boots, can have different primary stats - so you may have to hunt a little longer to find the right ones for a Champion's role.

Win Boots with ATK (%) as the primary stat from Stage 6 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Normal
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310038#static:
You've already collected three Artifacts with ATK (%) as their primary stats, and now it's time to put them to use.

Equip an ATK type Champion with Gauntlets, Chestplate, and Boots with ATK (%) as their primary stats.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310039#static:
There's strength in numbers. Join forces with other players in Clans to battle the Demon Lord for Shards, Gems, and Resources.

Apply to join an invite-only Clan, join a public Clan, or create your own.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310040#static:
There's always room for improvement. Upgrade another 2 Artifacts and see the difference they make.

Every 4 Levels, Artifacts will either unlock a new substat or upgrade an existing one, depending on its Rank.

Upgrade 2 more Artifacts to Level 12.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310041#static:
Show your enemies what you're made of. The better you do in Classic Arena, the higher your Tier, and the better the Bonuses you'll receive.

Keep fighting and keep winning to climb the ranks.

Win 5 Arena Offense battles in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310042#static:
The Palace of Aravia contains one of the most flexible Artifact Sets around - Speed. Master the location so you can keep coming back to grab more.

Clear Stage 4 of Palace of Aravia on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310043#static:
Once a Champion hits the Level cap for their Rank, they'll need to increase their Rank to level up further. To Upgrade a Champion's Rank, you need to sacrifice Champions of the same Rank. The number of Champions you need to sacrifice depends on the Rank.

Sacrifice three Rank 3 Champions to upgrade a Champion to Rank 4.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310044#static:
Higher Stages in the Dungeons are more difficult, but the Artifacts that drop there are far more powerful. Hard Stages also drop more powerful Artifacts than Normal Stages, but raiding them is a real test of your skills. Always raid the highest Dungeon Stage you can consistently beat.

Clear Stage 2 of the Ice Golem's Peak 3 times (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310045#static:
The stronger your Artifacts, the stronger your Champions.

Win one of each type of Speed Artifact - Weapon, Shield, Helmet, Chestplate, Gauntlets, and Boots - from clearing Palace of Aravia Stages on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310046#static:
There's always room for improvement. Upgrade another 2 Artifacts and see the difference they make. Every 4 Levels, Artifacts will either unlock a new substat or upgrade an existing one, depending on its Rank.

Upgrade 2 more Artifacts to Level 12.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310047#static:
Prepare yourself. It's only going to get tougher from here.

Clear Stage 7 of the Palace of Aravia on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310048#static:
To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth. Mastery Scrolls are different to all other items in Raid in that a Champion has to earn them for themselves by participating in battles. 

Every time you beat a stage in the Labyrinth, one of the Champions on your team will receive Scrolls.

Clear Stage 2 of Minotaur's Labyrinth 3 times.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310049#static:
Winning Medals lets you upgrade Affinity Bonuses at the Great Hall and unlock the power of your Champions. You can only win Medals from Classic Arena.

Keep fighting and win 10 Medals from Arena Offense battles in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310050#static:
You're ready to take the next step.

Clear Stage 7 of Tilshire on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310051#static:
Rank 4 is good, but there's still a long way to go.

Upgrade a Champion to Level 40 and get them ready for Rank 5.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310052#static:
There's always room for improvement. Upgrade another 2 Artifacts and see the difference they make. Every 4 Levels, Artifacts will either unlock a new substat or upgrade an existing one, depending on its Rank.

Upgrade 2 Artifacts to Level 12.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310053#static:
Mastering all the Artifact Dungeons is the only way to get your hands on the most powerful Artifacts in all of Teleria.

Prepare your Champions for battle and go head-to-head with the Fire Knight.

Clear Stage 1 of the Fire Knight's Castle (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310054#static:
Show your enemies what you're made of. The better you do in Classic Arena, the higher your Tier, and the better the Bonuses you'll receive.

Keep fighting and keep winning to climb the ranks.

Win 10 Arena Offense battles in Classic Arena.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310055#static:
The stronger your Artifacts, the stronger your Champions.

Win one of each type of Lifesteal Artifact - Weapon, Shield, Helmet, Chestplate, Gauntlets, and Boots - from clearing Valdemar Strait Stages on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310056#static:
The farther you go, the harder it gets. See if you can pass through the Valdemar Strait and reach the next location.

Clear Stage 7 of the Valdemar Strait on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310057#static:
Ascension increases a Champion's base stats, but can also grant unique bonuses - such as unlocking an extra Skill or upgrading an existing one. These unique changes usually happen at Ascension Level 3.

Ascend any Champion to Level 3 of Ascension and see what happens.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310058#static:
Upgrading the Great Hall gives your Champions huge global stat boosts. Upgrading Affinity Bonuses requires <color=#ffe87d>Medals, which can be only won in Classic Arena Battles</color>. Fully upgrading Bonuses at the Great Hall requires Bronze, Silver, and Gold Medals.

Upgrade an Affinity Bonus at the Great Hall.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310059#static:
Keep active and help your Clan win Rewards.

To see how to earn Stars, hit the Info icon in the top-left corner of the Clans interface.

Complete your daily Activity challenges and earn 3 Stars in a single day.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310060#static:
To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth. Mastery Scrolls are different to all other items in Raid in that a Champion has to earn them for themselves by participating in battles. 

Every time you beat a stage in the Labyrinth, one of the Champions on your team will receive Scrolls.

Clear Stage 4 of Minotaur's Labyrinth 2 times.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310061#static:
Masteries are special passive abilities that each Champion can unlock to enhance their performance. Masteries fall under one of three branches - Attack, Defense, or Support - to help Champions specialize for their role.

To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth.

Unlock a Mastery for one of your Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310062#static:
Your name will soon be known throughout all of Teleria.

Clear Stage 7 of the Deadlands on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310063#static:
Artifact Dungeons contain much stronger Artifacts than the Campaign map - and the Ice Golem's Peak contains some of the most flexible Sets around.

Keep raiding and win 5 Artifacts on the Ice Golem's Peak.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310064#static:
The stronger your Champions, the better your chances of winning. Keep your progress going and level up your Champions.

Upgrade 2 Champions to Level 40.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310065#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or adding new substats along the way. 

Equip 2 Champions with 6 Artifacts of Level 12 or higher.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310066#static:
You're almost there. Push through Godfrey's Crossing and you're one step closer to glory.

Clear Stage 7 of Godfrey's Crossing on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310067#static:
Arena battles are all about carnage.

Test your teams against other players and <color=#ffe87d>defeat 35 Champions</color> in Arena Offense battles in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310068#static:
Demon Lord Battles are collaborative quests where Clan members work together to take down a powerful Clan Boss. Do enough damage, and you will be rewarded well. Slay the Demon, and your Clan will be showered in riches.

Prove your worth to your Clan by dealing 500,000 damage to the Demon Lord in a single day.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310069#static:
Artifacts are the primary way of strengthening your Champions, from boosting their base stats, to providing unique bonuses and skill effects. These unique Set Bonuses help transform your Champions and let them fill new roles.

Win 1 Frost or Lifesteal Artifact from the Dragon's Lair from Stage 3 or higher (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310070#static:
You're almost there. Clear the Hallowed Halls and unlock the toughest Campaign location yet.

Clear Stage 7 of the Hallowed Halls on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310071#static:
Kitting your Champions out with the right Artifacts is essential for success. Make sure your attackers are capable of doing their job by giving them Artifacts that boost their ATK.

Equip 2 ATK Champions with Level 12+ Gauntlets, Boots, and a Chestplate with ATK (%) as their primary stats.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310072#static:
The stronger your Champions, the better your chances of winning. Keep your progress going and level up your Champions.

Upgrade 4 Champions to Level 40.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310073#static:
The Spider's Den is tough, but the rewards are worth it. Beating the Spider's Den is the main way to earn Accessories for your Champions. Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions.

Beat the Boss of the Spider's Den on Stage 1 (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310074#static:
Fight other players in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> to win Points and climb the Classic Arena Tiers. There are four Arena Tiers in Classic Arena - Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum - each of which grant global stat bonuses to your Champions simply for keeping your place in the Tier. It pays to stay active and maintain the highest position possible. The higher your Tier, the greater the bonuses you'll receive. But be warned... As the Tiers increase, so does the difficulty of your opponents.

Prove your skills by getting to Bronze III in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310075#static:
The final step in the Campaign. Can you handle it?

Clear Stage 7 of Brimstone Path on Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310076#static:
You've beaten the Campaign on Normal, but that's only the beginning. Now it's time to try out Hard mode. Each difficulty - Normal, Hard, and Brutal - has its own progress bar and Rewards, as well as increasingly strong Artifact drops.

Clear Stage 7 of Kaerok Castle on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310077#static:
To Upgrade a Champion's Rank, you need to sacrifice Champions of the same Rank. The number of Champions you need to sacrifice depends on the Rank.

Sacrifice four Rank 4 Champions to upgrade a Champion to Rank 5.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310078#static:
Clearing Dungeons on Auto saves time. The Ice Golem's Peak holds some of the most flexible Artifact Sets around. It's not the most difficult Dungeon, but helps set your Champions up for taking on Teleria's toughest challenges.

Clear Stage 5 of the Ice Golem's Peak 10 times on Auto.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310079#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or unlocking new substats along the way.

Choose the best Artifact in your collection and upgrade it to Level 16.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310080#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Kaerok Castle on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310081#static:
The Arcane Keep contains special Affinity-neutral Potions and is open every day. Since every Champion needs Arcane Potions for Ascension, you'll need to conquer this Dungeon if you want to stand any hope of becoming a Raid legend.

Win 25 Lesser Arcane Potions from Stage 5 or higher of the Arcane Keep
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310082#static:
Beat the second Campaign location on a harder difficulty and ready your Champions for tougher battles to come.

Clear Stage 7 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310083#static:
Clearing Dungeons on Auto saves time. The Dragon's Lair is a challenging Dungeon but it offers rich rewards, including unique Artifacts found nowhere else.

Clear Stage 5 of the Dragon's Lair 10 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310084#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars.

To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle.

Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310085#static:
The Magic Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Magic Champions. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Win 25 Lesser Magic Potions from Stage 5 or higher of the Magic Keep
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310086#static:
The stronger your Champions, the better your chances of winning. Keep your progress going and level up your Champions.

Upgrade a Champion to Level 50.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310087#static:
Fight other players in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> to win Points and climb the Classic Arena Tiers. There are four Arena Tiers in Classic Arena - Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum - each of which grant global stat bonuses to your Champions simply for keeping your place in the Tier.

It pays to stay active and maintain the highest position possible. The higher your Tier, the greater the bonuses you'll receive. But be warned... As the Tiers increase, so does the difficulty of your opponents.

Test your might and climb to Silver I in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310088#static:
You've proven to be a brave warrior, but there are more tests to come.

Clear Stage 7 of the Catacombs of Narbuk on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310089#static:
To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth. Mastery Scrolls are different to all other items in Raid in that a Champion has to earn them for themselves by participating in battles. Every time you beat a stage in the Labyrinth, one of the Champions on your team will receive Scrolls.

Clear Stage 5 of the Minotaur's Labyrinth 10 times on Auto.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310090#static:
Masteries are special passive abilities that each Champion can unlock to enhance their performance. Masteries fall under one of three branches - Attack, Defense, or Support - to help Champions specialize for their role. To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth.

Unlock three Tier 2 Masteries for 2 Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310091#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of the Catacombs of Narbuk on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310092#static:
Higher Stages in the Dungeons are more difficult, but the Artifacts that drop there are far more powerful. Hard Stages also drop more powerful Artifacts than Normal Stages, but raiding them is a real test of your skills. Always raid the highest Dungeon Stage you can consistently beat.

Win a total of five 4*, 5*, or 6* Artifacts from Stage 5 or higher of the Ice Golem's Peak (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310093#static:
To Upgrade a Champion's Rank, you need to sacrifice Champions of the same Rank. The number of Champions you need to sacrifice depends on the Rank.

Sacrifice four Rank 4 Champions to upgrade another Champion to Rank 5.

Win 25 Lesser Spirit Potions from Stage 5 or higher of the Spirit Keep.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310095#static:
It's time to cut through Durham Forest on Hard and move on to the next location.

Clear Stage 7 of Durham Forest on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310096#static:
Higher Stages in the Dungeons are more difficult, but the Artifacts that drop there are far more powerful. Hard Stages also drop more powerful Artifacts than Normal Stages, but raiding them is a real test of your skills. Always raid the highest Dungeon Stage you can consistently beat.

Win a total of five 4*, 5*, or 6* Artifacts from Stage 5 or higher of the Dragon's Lair (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310097#static:
Silver Medals allow you to upgrade any Affinity Bonus at the Great Hall to Level 6, while Gold Medals let you upgrade them to Level 10.

Earn 50 Silver or Gold Medals by winning Arena Offense battles in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310098#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or unlocking new substats along the way.

Choose a powerful Artifact from your collection and upgrade it to Level 16.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310099#static:
Clearing Dungeons on Auto saves time. The Fire Knight's Castle contains some of the rarest and most powerful Artifacts in all of Teleria, and being able to send your Champions in to raid it without your interaction is a necessity.

Clear Stage 3 of the Fire Knight's Castle 5 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310100#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Durham Forest on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310101#static:
The Force Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Force Champions.

All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Win 25 Lesser Force Potions from Stage 5 or higher of the Force Keep.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310102#static:
You're almost half-way through Hard mode, and it's only going to get tougher from here.

Clear Stage 7 of of Felwin's Gate on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310103#static:
The Void Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Void Champions. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Win 25 Lesser Void Potions from Stage 5 or higher of the Void Keep.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Felwin's Gate on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310105#static:
Beating the Spider's Den is the main way to earn Accessories for your Champions. Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions.

Clear Stage 3 of the Spider's Den 5 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310106#static:
A new challenge lies ahead. Can you reach the seventh location on Hard mode?

Clear Stage 7 of Palace of Aravia on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310107#static:
The stronger your Champions, the better your chances of winning. Keep your progress going and level up your Champions.

Upgrade 2 Champions to Level 50.

localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310146#static:
One more step and you've beaten Hard mode. Rise to the challenge.

Clear Stage 7 of Brimstone Path on Hard.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310147#static:
Demon Lord Battles are collaborative quests where Clan members work together to take down a powerful Clan Boss. Do enough damage, and you will be rewarded well. Slay the Demon, and your Clan will be showered in riches.

Prove your worth to your Clan by dealing 1,500,000 damage to the Demon Lord in a single day.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310148#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Brimstone Path on Hard difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310149#static:
Fight other players in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> to win Points and climb the Classic Arena Tiers. There are four Arena Tiers in Classic Arena - Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum - each of which grant global stat bonuses to your Champions simply for keeping your place in the Tier. It pays to stay active and maintain the highest position possible. The higher your Tier, the greater the bonuses you'll receive. But be warned... As the Tiers increase, so does the difficulty of your opponents.

Test your might and climb to Silver II in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310150#static:
Fusing Champions lets you turn weaker, lesser Champions into more sought-after powerful ones. Check the Champions you need to Fuse Justiciar from the Fusion section of the Portal.

Acquire those Champions, upgrade them, and fuse Justiciar.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310151#static:
You've beaten the Campaign on Hard, but there are more Stages ahead. Now it's time to try out Brutal mode. Each difficulty - Normal, Hard, and Brutal - has its own progress bar and Rewards, as well as increasingly strong Artifact drops.

Clear Stage 7 of Kaerok Castle on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310152#static:
To Upgrade a Champion's Rank, you need to sacrifice Champions of the same Rank. The number of Champions you need to sacrifice depends on the Rank.

Sacrifice five Rank 5 Champions to upgrade a Champion to Rank 6.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310153#static:
Clearing Dungeons on Auto saves time. The Ice Golem's Peak holds some of the most flexible Artifact Sets around. It's not the most difficult Dungeon, but helps set your Champions up for taking on Teleria's toughest challenges.

Clear Stage 10 or higher of the Ice Golem's Peak 10 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310154#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or unlocking new substats along the way.

Equip a Champion with 6 Level 16 Artifacts.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310155#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Kaerok Castle on Brutal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310156#static:
The Arcane Keep contains special Affinity-neutral Potions and is open every day. Since every Champion needs Arcane Potions for Ascension, you'll need to conquer this Dungeon if you want to stand any hope of becoming a Raid legend.

Win 1 Superior Arcane Potion from Stage 10 or higher of the Arcane Keep.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310157#static:
Beat the second Campaign location on the hardest difficulty and prove your skills.

Clear Stage 7 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310158#static:
Clearing Dungeons on Auto saves time. The Dragon's Lair is a challenging Dungeon but it offers rich rewards, including unique Artifacts found nowhere else.

Clear Stage 10 or higher of the Dragon's Lair 10 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310159#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of the Sewers of Arnoc on Brutal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310160#static:
The Magic Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Magic Champions. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Win 1 Superior Magic Potion from Stage 10 or higher of the Magic Keep.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310161#static:
The stronger your Champions, the better your chances of winning. 

Level 60 is the highest level a Champion can reach, meaning their base Stats are at their maximum potential.

Upgrade a Champion to Level 60.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310162#static:
Fight other players in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> to win Points and climb the Classic Arena Tiers. There are four Arena Tiers in Classic Arena - Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum - each of which grant global stat bonuses to your Champions simply for keeping your place in the Tier.

It pays to stay active and maintain the highest position possible. The higher your Tier, the greater the bonuses you'll receive. But be warned... As the Tiers increase, so does the difficulty of your opponents.

Test your might and climb to Silver III in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310163#static:
Now comes the true test of your might.

Clear Stage 7 of the Catacombs of Narbuk on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310164#static:
To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth. Mastery Scrolls are different to all other items in Raid in that a Champion has to earn them for themselves by participating in battles. Every time you beat a stage in the Labyrinth, one of the Champions on your team will receive Scrolls.

Clear Stage 10 or higher of the Minotaur's Labyrinth 10 times on Auto.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310165#static:
Masteries are special passive abilities that each Champion can unlock to enhance their performance. Masteries fall under one of three branches - Attack, Defense, or Support - to help Champions specialize for their role. To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth.

Unlock two Tier 4 Masteries for one Champion.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310166#static:
Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of the Catacombs of Narbuk on Brutal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310167#static:
Higher Stages in the Dungeons are more difficult, but the Artifacts that drop there are far more powerful. Hard Stages also drop more powerful Artifacts than Normal Stages, but raiding them is a real test of your skills. Always raid the highest Dungeon Stage you can consistently beat.

Win ten 5* or 6* Artifacts from Stage 10 or higher of the Ice Golem's Peak (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310168#static:
To Upgrade a Champion's Rank, you need to sacrifice Champions of the same Rank. The number of Champions you need to sacrifice depends on the Rank.

Sacrifice five Rank 5 Champions to upgrade another Champion to Rank 6.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310169#static:
The Spirit Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Spirit Champions. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Win 1 Superior Spirit Potion from Stage 10 or higher of the Spirit Keep.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310170#static:
Ready your Champions. The inhabitants of the Forest will not fall easily.

Clear Stage 7 of Durham Forest on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310171#static:
Higher Stages in the Dungeons are more difficult, but the Artifacts that drop there are far more powerful. Hard Stages also drop more powerful Artifacts than Normal Stages, but raiding them is a real test of your skills. Always raid the highest Dungeon Stage you can consistently beat.

Win ten 5* or 6* Artifacts from Stage 10 or higher of the Dragon's Lair (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310172#static:
Arena battles are all about carnage.

Test your teams against other players and <color=#ffe87d>defeat 75 Champions</color> in Arena Offense battles in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310173#static:
Upgrading Artifacts improves their power, increasing their primary stat, and increasing or adding new substats along the way. 

Equip 2 Champions with 6 Level 16 Artifacts.

Clearing Dungeons on Auto saves time. The Fire Knight's Castle contains some of the rarest and most powerful Artifacts in all of Teleria, and being able to send your Champions in to raid it without your interaction is a necessity.

Clear Stage 7 or higher of the Fire Knight's Castle 10 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).

Every Stage on the Campaign Map can be beaten in different ways to earn Stars. To earn 3 Stars, beat a Stage using no more than 2 Champions without either Champion dying during battle. Keep earning Stars to unlock extra rewards for your performance.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Durham Forest on Brutal difficulty.

The Force Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Force Champions. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Win 1 Superior Force Potion from Stage 10 or higher of the Force Keep.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310177#static:
Your legend grows, but you've not yet done enough. Keep going.

Clear Stage 7 of Felwin's Gate on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310178#static:

Win 1 Superior Void Potion from Stage 10 or higher of the Void Keep.

Earn 3 Stars on Stage 7 of Felwin's Gate on Brutal difficulty.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310180#static:
Beating the Spider's Den is the main way to earn Accessories for your Champions. Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions.

Clear Stage 7 or higher of the Spider's Den 10 times on Auto (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310181#static:
You've done well so far, but the toughest tests are yet to come. Are you ready?

Clear Stage 7 of Palace of Aravia on Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310182#static:
The stronger your Champions, the better your chances of winning. Keep your progress going and level up your Champions.

Upgrade 2 Champions to Level 60.

Prove your worth to your Clan by dealing 5,000,000 damage to the Demon Lord on a single difficulty in one day. Can be completed on any difficulty starting from Normal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310184#static:
Ascension increases a Champion's base stats, but can also grant unique bonuses - such as unlocking an extra Skill or upgrading an existing one. 

Ascend any Champion to Level 6 of Ascension.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310185#static:
The Spider's Den is tough, but the rewards are worth it. Beating the Spider's Den is the main way to earn Accessories for your Champions. Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions.

Win one 5* or 6* Amulet from Stage 7 or higher of the Spider's Den (on Normal or Hard).
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310186#static:
Silver Medals allow you to upgrade any Affinity Bonus at the Great Hall to Level 6, while Gold Medals let you upgrade them to Level 10.

Earn 150 Silver or Gold Medals by winning Arena Offense battles in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.

The Arcane Keep contains Arcane Potions used to Ascend Champions. Ascension increases Champions' base Stats and can even unlock new Skills. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Clear Stage 14 or higher of the Arcane Keep 10 times on Auto.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310239#static:
The Potion Mixer lets you combine multiple inferior Potions to make more powerful ones. Combine Lesser Potions to make Greater Potions, and Greater to make Superior Potions.

The Potion Mixer is a godsend when you need to Ascend a Champion of a certain Affinity when their Affinity Keep isn't open.

Mix 10 Superior Arcane Potions in the Tavern.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310240#static:
The Spirit Keep contains Potions used to Ascend Spirit Champions. All Champions require two Affinities of Potions to Ascend - the first is matched to their Affinity, while the second is Arcane, an Affinity-neutral type of Potion required by all Champions.

Clear Stage 14 or higher of the Spirit Keep 10 times on Auto.

Mix 10 Superior Spirit Potions in the Tavern.

The Potion Mixer is a godsend when you need to Ascend a Champion of a certain Affinity when their Affinity Keep isn't open.

Mix 10 Superior Void Potions in the Tavern.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310248#static:
Similar to Artifacts, Accessories provide significant stat boosts to your Champions. However, Accessories have a couple of key differences. They don't have Sets or Set Bonuses. Each Accessory belongs to a certain Faction, and can only be equipped by Champions belonging to that Faction.

Equip 3 Champions with a Ring, an Amulet, and a Banner.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310249#static:
Masteries are special passive abilities that each Champion can unlock to enhance their performance. Masteries fall under one of three branches - Attack, Defense, or Support - to help Champions specialize for their role. To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth.

Unlock a Tier 6 Mastery for 2 Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310250#static:
Fight other players in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color> to win Points and climb the Classic Arena Tiers. There are four Arena Tiers in Classic Arena - Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum - each of which grant global stat bonuses to your Champions simply for keeping your place in the Tier. It pays to stay active and maintain the highest position possible. The higher your Tier, the greater the bonuses you'll receive. But be warned... As the Tiers increase, so does the difficulty of your opponents.

Test your might and climb to Gold III in <color=#ffe87d>Classic Arena</color>.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310251#static:
Demon Lord Battles are collaborative quests where Clan members work together to take down a powerful Clan Boss. Do enough damage, and you will be rewarded well. Slay the Demon, and your Clan will be showered in riches.

Prove your worth to your Clan by dealing 15,000,000 damage to the Demon Lord on a single difficulty in one day. Can be completed on any difficulty starting from Brutal.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310252#static:
Upgrading the Great Hall gives your Champions huge global stat boosts. Upgrading Affinity Bonuses requires <color=#ffe87d>Medals, which can be only won in Classic Arena Battles</color>. Fully upgrading Bonuses at the Great Hall requires Bronze, Silver, and Gold Medals.

Upgrade an Affinity Bonus at the Great Hall to Level 8.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310253#static:
Masteries are special passive abilities that each Champion can unlock to enhance their performance. Masteries fall under one of three branches - Attack, Defense, or Support - to help Champions specialize for their role. To unlock Masteries, Champions will need to win Scrolls from the Minotaur's Labyrinth.

Unlock a Tier 6 Mastery for 3 Champions.
localizedStrings.l10n:quest/description?id=310254#static:
